<P class="p678 ft62">INTERNATIONAL TAX COMPLIANCE AND</P>
<P class="p678 ft62">TO IMPLEMENT FATCA</P>
<P class="p679 ft63">Whereas, the Government of Sweden and the Government of the United States of America (each, a “Party,” and together, the “Parties”) have a</P>
<P class="p680 ft63">longstanding and close relationship with respect to mutual assistance in tax matters and desire to conclude an agreement to improve international tax compliance by further building on that relationship;</P>
<P class="p681 ft63">Whereas, Article 26 of the Convention Between the Government of Sweden and the Government of the United States of America for the Avoidance of Double Taxation and the Prevention of Fiscal Evasion with Respect to Taxes on Income done at Stockholm on September 1, 1994, together with a related exchange of notes, and as amended by the</P>
<P class="p678 ft64">Protocol done at Washington on September 30, 2005, (together the</P>
<P class="p682 ft65">“Convention”), authorizes the exchange of information for tax purposes, including on an automatic basis;</P>
<P class="p683 ft63">Whereas, the United States of America enacted provisions commonly known as the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (“FATCA”), which</P>
<P class="p684 ft65">introduce a reporting regime for financial institutions with respect to certain accounts;</P>
<P class="p685 ft65">Whereas, the Government of Sweden is supportive of the underlying policy goal of FATCA to improve tax compliance;</P>
<P class="p686 ft65">Whereas, FATCA has raised a number of issues, including that Swedish financial institutions may not be able to comply with certain aspects of FATCA due to domestic legal impediments;</P>
<P class="p687 ft63">Whereas, the Government of the United States of America collects information regarding certain accounts maintained by U.S. financial institutions held by residents of Sweden and is committed to exchanging such information with the Government of Sweden and pursuing equivalent levels of exchange, provided that the appropriate safeguards and infrastructure for an effective exchange relationship are in place;</P>
<P class="p688 ft65">Whereas, the Parties are committed to working together over the longer term towards achieving common reporting and due diligence standards for financial institutions;</P>
<P class="p689 ft63">Whereas, the Government of the United States of America acknowledges the need to coordinate the reporting obligations under FATCA with other</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">207</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_208">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p690 ft65">U.S. tax reporting obligations of Swedish financial institutions to avoid duplicative reporting;</P>
<P class="p691 ft65">Whereas, an intergovernmental approach to FATCA implementation would address legal impediments and reduce burdens for Swedish financial institutions;</P>
<P class="p692 ft63">Whereas, the Parties desire to conclude an agreement to improve international tax compliance and provide for the implementation of FATCA based on domestic reporting and reciprocal automatic exchange pursuant to the Convention, and subject to the confidentiality and other protections provided for therein, including the provisions limiting the use of the information exchanged under the Convention;</P>
<P class="p693 ft65">Now, therefore, the Parties have agreed as follows:</P>
<P class="p694 ft66">Article 1</P>
<P class="p695 ft67">Definitions</P>
<P class="p696 ft64">1. For purposes of this agreement and any annexes thereto</P>
<P class="p697 ft65">(“Agreement”), the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below:</P>
<P class="p698 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“United States” </SPAN>means the United States of America, including the States thereof, and, when used in a geographical sense, means the territory of the United States of America, including inland waters, the air space, the territorial sea thereof and any maritime area beyond the territorial sea within which the United States may exercise sovereign rights or jurisdiction in accordance with international law; the term, however,</P>
<P class="p699 ft63">does not include the U.S. Territories. Any reference to a “<SPAN class="ft70">State</SPAN>” of the United States includes the District of</P>
<P class="p700 ft65">Columbia.</P>
<P class="p701 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft71">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">“U.S. Territory” </SPAN>means American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, or the U.S. Virgin Islands.</P>
<P class="p702 ft65"><SPAN class="ft68">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft72">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">“IRS” </SPAN>means the U.S. Internal Revenue Service.</P>
<P class="p701 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft71">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">“Sweden” </SPAN>means the Kingdom of Sweden and, when used in a geographical sense, includes the national territory, the territorial sea as well as other maritime areas over which Sweden may exercise sovereign rights or jurisdiction, in accordance with international law.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">208</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_209">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p703 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Partner Jurisdiction” </SPAN>means a jurisdiction that has in effect an agreement with the United States to facilitate the implementation of FATCA. The IRS shall publish a list identifying all Partner Jurisdictions.</P>
<P class="p704 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">The term </SPAN>“Competent Authority” <SPAN class="ft65">means:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p705 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">in the case of the United States, the Secretary of the Treasury or his delegate; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p705 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">in the case of Sweden, the Minister of Finance, his authorized representative or the authority which is designated as a competent authority for the purposes of this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p706 ft77"><SPAN class="ft63">g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft75">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft76">“Financial Institution” </SPAN>means a Custodial Institution, a Depository Institution, an Investment Entity, or a Specified Insurance Company.</P>
<P class="p707 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft78">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft66">“Custodial Institution” </SPAN>means any Entity that holds, as a substantial portion of its business, financial assets for the account of others. An entity</P>
<P class="p708 ft63">holds financial assets for the account of others as a substantial portion of its business if the entity’s gross income attributable to the holding of financial assets</P>
<P class="p709 ft79">and related financial services equals or exceeds 20 percent of the entity’s gross income during the shorter of: (i) the three­year period that ends on December 31 (or the final day of a non­calendar year accounting period) prior to the year in which the determination is being made; or (ii) the period during which the entity has been in existence.</P>
<P class="p710 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft80">The term </SPAN>“Depository Institution” <SPAN class="ft65">means any Entity that accepts deposits in the ordinary course of a banking or similar business.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p711 ft63"><SPAN class="ft65">j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft81">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Investment Entity” </SPAN>means any Entity that conducts as a business (or is managed by an entity that conducts as a business) one or more of the following activities or operations for or on behalf of a customer:</P>
<P class="p712 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft82">trading in money market instruments (cheques, bills, certificates of deposit, derivatives, etc.); foreign exchange; exchange, interest rate and index instruments; transferable securities; or commodity futures trading;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p713 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">individual and collective portfolio management; or</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">209</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_210">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p714 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">otherwise investing, administering, or managing funds or money on behalf of other persons.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p715 ft63">This subparagraph 1(j) shall be interpreted in a manner consistent with similar language set forth in the definition of “financial institution” in the</P>
<P class="p716 ft65">Financial Action Task Force Recommendations.</P>
<P class="p717 ft70"><SPAN class="ft65">k)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">The term </SPAN>“Specified Insurance Company” <SPAN class="ft63">means any Entity that is an insurance company (or the holding company of an insurance company) that issues, or is obligated to make payments with respect to, a Cash Value Insurance Contract or an Annuity Contract.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p718 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">l)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft80">The term </SPAN>“Swedish Financial Institution” <SPAN class="ft65">means (i) any Financial Institution resident in Sweden, but excluding any branch of such Financial Institution that is located outside Sweden, and (ii) any branch of a Financial Institution not resident in Sweden, if such branch is located in Sweden.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p719 ft67"><SPAN class="ft63">m)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">The term </SPAN>“Partner Jurisdiction Financial Institution” <SPAN class="ft65">means (i) any Financial Institution established in a Partner Jurisdiction, but excluding any branch of such Financial Institution that is located outside the Partner Jurisdiction, and (ii) any branch of a Financial Institution not established in the Partner Jurisdiction, if such branch is located in the Partner Jurisdiction.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p720 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">n)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">The term </SPAN>“Reporting Financial Institution” <SPAN class="ft63">means a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution or a Reporting U.S. Financial Institution, as the context requires.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p721 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">o)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">The term </SPAN>“Reporting Swedish Financial Institution” <SPAN class="ft63">means any Swedish Financial Institution that is not a Non­Reporting Swedish Financial Institution.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p722 ft66"><SPAN class="ft63">p)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft78">The term </SPAN>“Reporting U.S. Financial Institution” <SPAN class="ft79">means (i) any Financial Institution that is resident in the United States, but excluding any branch of such Financial Institution that is located outside the United States, and (ii) any branch of a Financial Institution not resident in the United States, if such branch is located in the United States, provided that the Financial Institution or branch has control, receipt, or custody of income with respect to which information is required to be exchanged under subparagraph (2)(b) of Article 2 of this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">210</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_211">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p723 ft67"><SPAN class="ft63">q)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft71">The term </SPAN>“Non­Reporting Swedish Financial</P>
<P class="p724 ft63"><SPAN class="ft70">Institution” </SPAN>means any Swedish Financial Institution, or other Entity resident in Sweden, that is described in Annex II as a Non­Reporting Swedish Financial Institution or that otherwise qualifies as a deemed­ compliant FFI or an exempt beneficial owner under relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations in effect on the date of signature of this Agreement.</P>
<P class="p725 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">r)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">The term </SPAN>“Nonparticipating Financial Institution” <SPAN class="ft63">means a nonparticipating FFI, as that term is defined in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations, but does not include a Swedish Financial Institution or other Partner Jurisdiction Financial Institution other than a Financial Institution treated as a Nonparticipating Financial Institution pursuant to subparagraph 2(b) of Article 5 of this Agreement or the corresponding provision in an agreement between the United States and a Partner Jurisdiction.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p726 ft65"><SPAN class="ft68">s)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">“Financial Account” </SPAN>means an account maintained by a Financial Institution, and includes:</P>
<P class="p727 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">in the case of an Entity that is a Financial Institution solely because it is an Investment Entity, any equity or debt interest (other than interests that are regularly traded on an established securities market) in the Financial Institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p728 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft82">in the case of a Financial Institution not described in subparagraph 1(s)(1) of this Article, any equity or debt interest in the Financial Institution (other than interests that are regularly traded on an established securities market), if (i) the value of the debt or equity interest is determined, directly or indirectly, primarily by reference to assets that give rise to U.S. Source Withholdable Payments, and (ii) the class of interests was established with a purpose of avoiding reporting in accordance with this Agreement; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p729 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft82">any Cash Value Insurance Contract and any Annuity Contract issued or maintained by a Financial Institution, other than a noninvestment­linked, nontransferable immediate life annuity that is issued to an individual and monetizes a pension or disability benefit provided under an account</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">211</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_212">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p730 ft65">that is excluded from the definition of Financial Account in Annex II.</P>
<P class="p692 ft63">Notwithstanding the foregoing, the term “Financial Account” does not include any account that is excluded from the definition of Financial</P>
<P class="p716 ft64">Account in Annex II. For purposes of this Agreement, interests are</P>
<P class="p731 ft63">“regularly traded” if there is a meaningful volume of trading with respect to the interests on an ongoing basis, and an “established securities market” means an exchange that is officially recognized and supervised</P>
<P class="p731 ft63">by a governmental authority in which the market is located and that has a meaningful annual value of shares traded on the exchange. For purposes</P>
<P class="p716 ft64">of this subparagraph 1(s), an interest in a Financial Institution is not</P>
<P class="p732 ft63">“regularly traded” and shall be treated as a Financial Account if the holder of the interest (other than a Financial Institution acting as an intermediary) is registered on the books of such Financial Institution. The preceding sentence will not apply to interests first registered on the books of such Financial Institution prior to July 1, 2014, and with respect to interests first registered on the books of such Financial Institution on or after July 1, 2014, a Financial Institution is not required to apply the preceding sentence prior to January 1, 2016.</P>
<P class="p721 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">t)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft81">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Depository Account” </SPAN>includes any commercial, checking, savings, time, or thrift account, or an account that is evidenced by a certificate of deposit, thrift certificate, investment certificate, certificate of indebtedness, or other similar instrument maintained by a Financial Institution in the ordinary course of a banking or similar business. A Depository Account also includes an amount held by an insurance company pursuant to a guaranteed investment contract or similar agreement to pay or credit interest thereon.</P>
<P class="p733 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">u)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Custodial Account” </SPAN>means an account (other than an Insurance Contract or Annuity Contract) for the benefit of another person that holds any financial instrument or contract held for investment (including, but not limited to, a share or stock in a corporation, a note, bond, debenture, or other evidence of indebtedness, a currency or commodity transaction, a credit default swap, a swap based upon a nonfinancial index, a notional principal contract, an Insurance Contract or Annuity Contract, and any option or other derivative instrument).</P>
<P class="p734 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Equity Interest” </SPAN>means, in the case of a partnership that is a Financial Institution, either a capital or profits interest in the partnership. In the case of a trust that is a Financial Institution, an Equity Interest is considered to be held by any person treated as a settlor or beneficiary of all or a portion of the trust, or any other natural person exercising ultimate</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">212</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_213">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p735 ft79">effective control over the trust. A Specified U.S. Person shall be treated as being a beneficiary of a foreign trust if such Specified U.S. Person has the right to receive directly or indirectly (for example, through a nominee) a mandatory distribution or may receive, directly or indirectly, a discretionary distribution from the trust.</P>
<P class="p725 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">w)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Insurance Contract” </SPAN>means a contract (other than an Annuity Contract) under which the issuer agrees to pay an amount upon the occurrence of a specified contingency involving mortality, morbidity, accident, liability, or property risk.</P>
<P class="p736 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">x)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Annuity Contract” </SPAN>means a contract under which the issuer agrees to make payments for a period of time determined in whole or in part by reference to the life expectancy of one or more individuals. The term also includes a contract that is considered to be an Annuity Contract in accordance with the law, regulation, or practice of the jurisdiction in which the contract was issued, and under which the issuer agrees to make payments for a term of years.</P>
<P class="p737 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">y)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">The term </SPAN>“Cash Value Insurance Contract” <SPAN class="ft63">means an Insurance Contract (other than an indemnity reinsurance contract between two insurance companies) that has a Cash Value greater than $50,000.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p736 ft63"><SPAN class="ft65">z)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Cash Value” </SPAN>means the greater of (i) the amount that the policyholder is entitled to receive upon surrender or termination of the contract (determined without reduction for any surrender charge or policy loan), and (ii) the amount the policyholder can borrow</P>
<P class="p738 ft63">under or with regard to the contract. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the term “Cash Value” does not include an amount payable under an Insurance Contract as:</P>
<P class="p712 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">a personal injury or sickness benefit or other benefit providing indemnification of an economic loss incurred upon the occurrence of the event insured against;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p739 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">a refund to the policyholder of a previously paid premium under an Insurance Contract (other than under a life insurance contract) due to policy cancellation or termination, decrease in risk exposure during the effective period of the Insurance Contract, or arising from a redetermination of the premium due to correction of posting or other similar error; or</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">213</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_214">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p740 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">a policyholder dividend based upon the underwriting experience of the contract or group involved.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p741 ft65"><SPAN class="ft68">aa)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft88">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">“Reportable Account” </SPAN>means a U.S. Reportable Account or a Swedish Reportable Account, as the context requires.</P>
<P class="p717 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">bb)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft89">The term </SPAN>“Swedish Reportable Account” <SPAN class="ft63">means a Financial Account maintained by a Reporting U.S. Financial Institution if: (i) in the case of a Depository Account, the account is held by an individual resident in Sweden and more than $10 of interest is paid to such account in any given calendar year; or (ii) in the case of a Financial Account other than a Depository Account, the Account Holder is a resident of Sweden, including an Entity that certifies that it is resident in Sweden for tax purposes, with respect to which U.S. source income that is subject to reporting under chapter 3 of subtitle A or chapter 61 of subtitle F of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code is paid or credited.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p742 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">cc)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft90">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“U.S. Reportable Account” </SPAN>means a Financial Account maintained by a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution and held by one or more Specified U.S. Persons or by a Non­U.S. Entity with one or more Controlling Persons that is a Specified U.S. Person. Notwithstanding the foregoing, an account shall not be treated as a U.S. Reportable Account if such account is not identified as a U.S. Reportable Account after application of the due diligence procedures in Annex I.</P>
<P class="p733 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">dd)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft89">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Account Holder</SPAN>” means the person listed or identified as the holder of a Financial Account by the Financial Institution that maintains the account. A person, other than a Financial Institution, holding a Financial Account for the benefit or account of another person as agent, custodian, nominee, signatory, investment advisor, or intermediary, is not treated as holding the account for purposes of this Agreement, and such other person is treated as holding the account.</P>
<P class="p699 ft63">For purposes of the immediately preceding sentence, the term “Financial Institution” does not include a</P>
<P class="p743 ft63">Financial Institution organized or incorporated in a U.S. Territory. In the case of a Cash Value Insurance Contract or an Annuity Contract, the Account Holder is any person entitled to access the Cash Value or change the beneficiary of the contract. If no person can access the Cash Value or change the beneficiary, the Account</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">214</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_215">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p735 ft79">Holder is any person named as the owner in the contract and any person with a vested entitlement to payment under the terms of the contract. Upon the maturity of a Cash Value Insurance Contract or an Annuity Contract, each person entitled to receive a payment under the contract is treated as an Account Holder.</P>
<P class="p725 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">ee)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft90">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“U.S. Person” </SPAN>means a U.S. citizen or resident individual, a partnership or corporation organized in the United States or under the laws of the United States or any State thereof, a trust if (i) a court within the United States would have authority under applicable law to render orders or judgments concerning substantially all issues regarding administration of the trust, and (ii) one or more U.S. persons have the authority to control all substantial decisions of the trust, or an estate of a decedent that is a citizen or resident of the United States. This subparagraph 1(ee) shall be interpreted in accordance with the U.S. Internal Revenue Code.</P>
<P class="p744 ft70"><SPAN class="ft65">ff)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft87">The term </SPAN>“Specified U.S. Person” <SPAN class="ft63">means a U.S. Person, other than: (i) a corporation the stock of which is regularly traded on one or more established securities markets; (ii) any corporation that is a member of the same expanded affiliated group, as defined in section 1471(e)(2) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code, as a corporation described in clause (i);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p745 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(iii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft91">the United States or any wholly owned agency or instrumentality thereof; (iv) any State of the United States, any U.S. Territory, any political subdivision of any of the foregoing, or any wholly owned agency or instrumentality of any one or more of the foregoing;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p746 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(v)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft92">any organization exempt from taxation under section 501(a) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code or an individual retirement plan as defined in section 7701(a)(37) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code; (vi) any bank as defined in section 581 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code; (vii) any real estate investment trust as defined in section 856 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code; (viii) any regulated investment company as defined in section 851 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code or any entity registered with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission under the Investment Company Act of 1940 (15 U.S.C. 80a­64); (ix) any common trust fund as defined in section 584(a) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code; (x) any trust that is exempt from tax under section 664(c) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code or that is described in section 4947(a)(1) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code; (xi) a</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">215</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_216">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p747 ft79">dealer in securities, commodities, or derivative financial instruments (including notional principal contracts, futures, forwards, and options) that is registered as such under the laws of the United States or any State; (xii) a broker as defined in section 6045(c) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code; or (xiii) any tax­exempt trust under a plan that is described in section 403(b) or section 457(g) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code.</P>
<P class="p748 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">gg)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft93">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">“Entity” </SPAN>means a legal person or a legal arrangement such as a trust.</P>
<P class="p749 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">hh)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft93">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">“Non­U.S. Entity” </SPAN>means an Entity that is not a U.S. Person.</P>
<P class="p717 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft94">The term </SPAN>“U.S. Source Withholdable Payment” <SPAN class="ft63">means any payment of interest (including any original issue discount), dividends, rents, salaries, wages, premiums, annuities, compensations, remunerations, emoluments, and other fixed or determinable annual or periodical gains, profits, and income, if such payment is from sources within the United States. Notwithstanding the foregoing, a U.S. Source Withholdable Payment does not include any payment that is not treated as a withholdable payment in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p750 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">jj)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft94">An Entity is a </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Related Entity” </SPAN>of another Entity if either Entity controls the other Entity, or the two Entities are under common control. For this purpose control includes direct or indirect ownership of more than 50 percent of the vote or value in an Entity. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Sweden may treat an Entity as not a Related Entity of another Entity if the two Entities are not members of the same expanded affiliated group as defined in section 1471(e)(2) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code.</P>
<P class="p751 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">kk)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft93">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">“U.S. TIN” </SPAN>means a U.S. federal taxpayer identifying number.</P>
<P class="p701 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">ll)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft95">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">“Swedish TIN” </SPAN>means a Swedish taxpayer identifying number.</P>
<P class="p698 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">mm)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft96">The term </SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">“Controlling Persons” </SPAN>means the natural persons who exercise control over an Entity. In the case of a trust, such term means the settlor, the trustees, the protector (if any), the beneficiaries or class of beneficiaries, and any other natural person exercising ultimate effective control over the trust, and in the case</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">216</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_217">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p752 ft79">of a legal arrangement other than a trust, such term</P>
<P class="p753 ft63">means persons in equivalent or similar positions. The term “Controlling Persons” shall be interpreted in a</P>
<P class="p754 ft65">manner consistent with the Financial Action Task Force Recommendations.</P>
<P class="p687 ft63">2. Any term not otherwise defined in this Agreement shall, unless the context otherwise requires or the Competent Authorities agree to a common meaning (as permitted by domestic law), have the meaning that it has at that time under the law of the Party applying this Agreement, any meaning under the applicable tax laws of that Party prevailing over a meaning given to the term under other laws of that Party.</P>
<P class="p755 ft66">Article 2</P>
<P class="p756 ft66">Obligations to Obtain and Exchange Information with Respect to</P>
<P class="p757 ft67">Reportable Accounts</P>
<P class="p679 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft72">Subject to the provisions of Article 3 of this Agreement, each Party shall obtain the information specified in paragraph 2 of this Article with respect to all Reportable Accounts and shall annually exchange this information with the other Party on an automatic basis pursuant to the provisions of Article 26 of the Convention.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p758 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft72">The information to be obtained and exchanged is:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p710 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft72">In the case of Sweden with respect to each U.S. Reportable Account of each Reporting Swedish Financial Institution:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p759 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft82">the name, address, and U.S. TIN of each Specified U.S. Person that is an Account Holder of such account and, in the case of a Non­U.S. Entity that, after application of the due diligence procedures set forth in Annex I, is identified as having one or more Controlling Persons that is a Specified U.S. Person, the name, address, and U.S. TIN (if any) of such entity and each such Specified U.S. Person;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p760 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">the account number (or functional equivalent in the absence of an account number);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p761 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">the name and identifying number of the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p762 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">the account balance or value (including, in the case of a Cash Value Insurance Contract or Annuity Contract, the Cash Value or surrender value) as of the end of the relevant calendar year or other appropriate reporting period or,</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">217</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_218">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p730 ft65">if the account was closed during such year, immediately before closure;</P>
<P class="p763 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">in the case of any Custodial Account:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p764 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">the total gross amount of interest, the total gross amount of dividends, and the total gross amount of other income generated with respect to the assets held in the account, in each case paid or credited to the account (or with respect to the account) during the calendar year or other appropriate reporting period; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p765 ft79"><SPAN class="ft79">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft98">the total gross proceeds from the sale or redemption of property paid or credited to the account during the calendar year or other appropriate reporting period with respect to which the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution acted as a custodian, broker, nominee, or otherwise as an agent for the Account Holder;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p766 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">in the case of any Depository Account, the total gross amount of interest paid or credited to the account during the calendar year or other appropriate reporting period; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p767 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(7)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">in the case of any account not described in subparagraph 2(a)(5) or 2(a)(6) of this Article, the total gross amount paid or credited to the Account Holder with respect to the account during the calendar year or other appropriate reporting period with respect to which the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is the obligor or debtor, including the aggregate amount of any redemption payments made to the Account Holder during the calendar year or other appropriate reporting period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p768 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft71">In the case of the United States, with respect to each Swedish Reportable Account of each Reporting U.S. Financial Institution:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p769 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">the name, address, and Swedish TIN of any person that is a resident of Sweden and is an Account Holder of the account;</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">218</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_219">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p728 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">the account number (or the functional equivalent in the absence of an account number);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p770 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">the name and identifying number of the Reporting U.S. Financial Institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p770 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">the gross amount of interest paid on a Depository Account;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p762 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">the gross amount of U.S. source dividends paid or credited to the account; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p762 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(6)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">the gross amount of other U.S. source income paid or credited to the account, to the extent subject to reporting under chapter 3 of subtitle A or chapter 61 of subtitle F of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p771 ft66">Article 3</P>
<P class="p772 ft67">Time and Manner of Exchange of Information</P>
<P class="p685 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft99">For purposes of the exchange obligation in Article 2 of this Agreement, the amount and characterization of payments made with respect to a U.S. Reportable Account may be determined in accordance with the principles of the tax laws of Sweden, and the amount and characterization of payments made with respect to a Swedish Reportable Account may be determined in accordance with principles of U.S. federal income tax law.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p773 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft72">For purposes of the exchange obligation in Article 2 of this Agreement, the information exchanged shall identify the currency in which each relevant amount is denominated.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p774 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft99">With respect to paragraph 2 of Article 2 of this Agreement, information is to be obtained and exchanged with respect to 2014 and all subsequent years, except that:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p775 ft65"><SPAN class="ft68">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft72">In the case of Sweden:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p762 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">the information to be obtained and exchanged with respect to 2014 is only the information described in subparagraphs 2(a)(1) through 2(a)(4) of Article 2 of this Agreement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p705 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">the information to be obtained and exchanged with respect to 2015 is the information described in subparagraphs 2(a)(1) through 2(a)(7) of Article 2 of this Agreement, except for gross proceeds described in subparagraph 2(a)(5)(B) of Article 2 of this Agreement; and</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">219</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_220">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p776 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">the information to be obtained and exchanged with respect to 2016 and subsequent years is the information described in subparagraphs 2(a)(1) through 2(a)(7) of Article 2 of this Agreement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p721 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">In the case of the United States, the information to be obtained and exchanged with respect to 2014 and subsequent years is all of the information identified in subparagraph 2(b) of Article 2 of this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p777 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">Notwithstanding paragraph 3 of this Article, with respect to each Reportable Account that is maintained by a Reporting Financial Institution as of June 30, 2014, and subject to paragraph 4 of Article 6 of this Agreement, the Parties are not required to obtain and include in the exchanged information the Swedish TIN or the U.S. TIN, as applicable, of any relevant person if such taxpayer identifying number is not in the records of the Reporting Financial Institution. In such a case, the Parties shall obtain and include in the exchanged information the date of birth of the relevant person, if the Reporting Financial Institution has such date of birth in its records.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p778 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft71">Subject to paragraphs 3 and 4 of this Article, the information described in Article 2 of this Agreement shall be exchanged within nine months after the end of the calendar year to which the information relates.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p692 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">The Competent Authorities of Sweden and the United States shall enter into an agreement or arrangement under the mutual agreement procedure provided for in Article 25 of the Convention, which shall:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p721 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">establish the procedures for the automatic exchange obligations described in Article 2 of this Agreement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p779 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">prescribe rules and procedures as may be necessary to implement Article 5 of this Agreement; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p780 ft65"><SPAN class="ft68">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft72">establish as necessary procedures for the exchange of the information reported under subparagraph 1(b) of Article 4 of this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p781 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">All information exchanged shall be subject to the confidentiality and other protections provided for in the Convention, including the provisions limiting the use of the information exchanged.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p777 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">Following entry into force of this Agreement, each Competent Authority shall provide written notification to the other Competent Authority when it is satisfied that the jurisdiction of the other Competent Authority has in place (i) appropriate safeguards to ensure that the information received pursuant to this Agreement shall remain confidential and be used solely for tax purposes, and (ii) the</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">220</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_221">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p782 ft79">infrastructure for an effective exchange relationship (including established processes for ensuring timely, accurate, and confidential information exchanges, effective and reliable communications, and demonstrated capabilities to promptly resolve questions and concerns about exchanges or requests for exchanges and to administer the provisions of Article 5 of this Agreement). The Competent Authorities shall endeavor in good faith to meet, prior to September 2015, to establish that each jurisdiction has such safeguards and infrastructure in place.</P>
<P class="p783 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">The obligations of the Parties to obtain and exchange information under Article 2 of this Agreement shall take effect on the date of the later of the written notifications described in paragraph 8 of this Article. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if the Swedish Competent Authority is satisfied that the United States has the safeguards and infrastructure described in paragraph 8 of this Article in place, but additional time is necessary for the U.S. Competent Authority to establish that Sweden has such safeguards and infrastructure in place, the obligation of Sweden to obtain and exchange information under Article 2 of this Agreement shall take effect on the date of the written notification provided by the Swedish Competent Authority to the U.S. Competent Authority pursuant to paragraph 8 of this Article.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p784 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft93">This Agreement shall terminate on September 30, 2015, if Article 2 of this Agreement is not in effect for either Party pursuant to paragraph 9 of this Article by that date.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p785 ft66">Article 4</P>
<P class="p786 ft67">Application of FATCA to Swedish Financial Institutions</P>
<P class="p787 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">1. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">Treatment of Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p788 ft79">Each Reporting Swedish Financial Institution shall be treated as complying with, and not subject to withholding under, section 1471 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code if Sweden complies with its obligations under Articles 2 and 3 of this Agreement with respect to such Reporting Swedish Financial Institution, and the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution:</P>
<P class="p725 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">identifies U.S. Reportable Accounts and reports annually to the Swedish Competent Authority the information required to be reported in subparagraph 2(a) of Article 2 of this Agreement in the time and manner described in Article 3 of this Agreement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p789 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft71">for each of 2015 and 2016, reports annually to the Swedish Competent Authority the name of each Nonparticipating Financial Institution to which it has made payments and the aggregate amount of such payments;</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">221</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_222">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p722 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">complies with the applicable registration requirements on the IRS FATCA registration website;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p721 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft84">to the extent that a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is (i) acting as a qualified intermediary (for purposes of section 1441 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code) that has elected to assume primary withholding responsibility under chapter 3 of subtitle A of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code, (ii) a foreign partnership that has elected to act as a withholding foreign partnership (for purposes of both sections 1441 and 1471 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code), or (iii) a foreign trust that has elected to act as a withholding foreign trust (for purposes of both sections 1441 and 1471 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code), withholds 30 percent of any U.S. Source Withholdable Payment to any Nonparticipating Financial Institution; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p750 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">in the case of a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution that is not described in subparagraph 1(d) of this Article and that makes a payment of, or acts as an intermediary with respect to, a U.S. Source Withholdable Payment to any Nonparticipating Financial Institution, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution provides to any immediate payor of such U.S. Source Withholdable Payment the information required for withholding and reporting to occur with respect to such payment.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p790 ft63">Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution with respect to which the conditions of this paragraph 1 are not satisfied shall not be subject to withholding under section 1471 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code unless such Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is treated by the IRS as a Nonparticipating Financial Institution pursuant to subparagraph 2(b) of Article 5 of this Agreement.</P>
<P class="p777 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">2. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">Suspension of Rules Relating to Recalcitrant Accounts</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">The United States shall not require a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution to withhold tax under section 1471 or 1472 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code with respect to an account held by a recalcitrant account holder (as defined in section 1471(d)(6) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code), or to close such account, if the U.S. Competent Authority receives the information set forth in subparagraph 2(a) of Article 2 of this Agreement, subject to the provisions of Article 3 of this Agreement, with respect to such account.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p791 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">3. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">Specific Treatment of Swedish Retirement Plans</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">The United States shall treat as deemed­compliant FFIs or exempt beneficial owners, as appropriate, for purposes of sections 1471 and 1472 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code, Swedish retirement plans described in Annex II. For this purpose, a Swedish retirement plan includes an Entity</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">222</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_223">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p792 ft65">established or located in, and regulated by, Sweden, or a predetermined contractual or legal arrangement, operated to provide pension or retirement benefits or earn income for providing such benefits under the laws of Sweden and regulated with respect to contributions, distributions, reporting, sponsorship, and taxation.</P>
<P class="p793 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">4. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft102">Identification and Treatment of Other Deemed­Compliant FFIs and Exempt Beneficial Owners</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft65">The United States shall treat each Non­Reporting Swedish Financial Institution as a deemed­ compliant FFI or as an exempt beneficial owner, as appropriate, for purposes of section 1471 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p794 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">5. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">Special Rules Regarding Related Entities and Branches That Are Nonparticipating Financial Institutions</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">If a Swedish Financial Institution, that otherwise meets the requirements described in paragraph 1 of this Article or is described in paragraph 3 or 4 of this Article, has a Related Entity or branch that operates in a jurisdiction that prevents such Related Entity or branch from fulfilling the requirements of a participating FFI or deemed­compliant FFI for purposes of section 1471 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code or has a Related Entity or branch that is treated as a Nonparticipating Financial Institution solely due to the expiration of the transitional rule for limited FFIs and limited branches under relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations, such Swedish Financial Institution shall continue to be in compliance with the terms of this Agreement and shall continue to be treated as a deemed­compliant FFI or exempt beneficial owner, as appropriate, for purposes of section 1471 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code, provided that:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p795 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft99">the Swedish Financial Institution treats each such Related Entity or branch as a separate Nonparticipating Financial Institution for purposes of all the reporting and withholding requirements of this Agreement and each such Related Entity or branch identifies itself to withholding agents as a Nonparticipating Financial Institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p795 ft79"><SPAN class="ft79">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft78">each such Related Entity or branch identifies its U.S. accounts and reports the information with respect to those accounts as required under section 1471 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code to the extent permitted under the relevant laws pertaining to the Related Entity or branch; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p737 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">such Related Entity or branch does not specifically solicit U.S. accounts held by persons that are not resident in the jurisdiction where such Related Entity or branch is located or accounts held by Nonparticipating Financial Institutions that are not established in the jurisdiction where such Related Entity or branch is located, and such Related Entity or branch is not used by the Swedish Financial Institution</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">223</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_224">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t66">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td215"><P class="p3 ft103">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td15"><P class="p16 ft65">or any other Related Entity to circumvent the</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td215"><P class="p3 ft103">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td15"><P class="p16 ft65">obligations under this Agreement or under section</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td215"><P class="p3 ft104">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><P class="p16 ft79">1471 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code, as</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td215"><P class="p3 ft104">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><P class="p796 ft79">appropriate.</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr29 td215"><P class="p3 ft65">6.</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr29 td15"><P class="p16 ft63"><SPAN class="ft101">Coordination of Timing</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">. </SPAN>Notwithstanding paragraphs 3 and 5</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr6 td225"><P class="p3 ft79">of Article 3 of this Agreement:</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr25 td215"><P class="p3 ft65">a)</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr25 td15"><P class="p16 ft65">Sweden shall not be obligated to obtain and</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p797 ft65">exchange information with respect to a calendar year that is prior to the calendar year with respect to which similar information is required to be reported to the IRS by participating FFIs pursuant to relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations;</P>
<P class="p690 ft65">b) Sweden shall not be obligated to begin exchanging information prior to the date by which participating FFIs are required to report similar information to the IRS under relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations;</P>
<P class="p690 ft65">c) the United States shall not be obligated to obtain and exchange information with respect to a calendar year that is prior to the first calendar year with respect to which Sweden is required to obtain and exchange information; and</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t67">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td226"><P class="p3 ft65">d)</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td67"><P class="p323 ft65">the</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td227"><P class="p16 ft63">United States shall not be obligated to</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td226"><P class="p3 ft65">begin exchanging</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td67"><P class="p323 ft63">information</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td227"><P class="p16 ft65">prior to the date by which Sweden is</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p716 ft65">required to begin exchanging information.</P>
<P class="p798 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">7. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">Coordination of Definitions with U.S. Treasury Regulations</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">Notwithstanding Article 1 of this Agreement and the definitions provided in the Annexes to this Agreement, in implementing this Agreement, Sweden may use, and may permit Swedish Financial Institutions to use, a definition in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations in lieu of a corresponding definition in this Agreement, provided that such application would not frustrate the purposes of this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p799 ft66">Article 5</P>
<P class="p800 ft67">Collaboration on Compliance and Enforcement</P>
<P class="p801 ft79">1. <SPAN class="ft100">Minor and Administrative Errors</SPAN><SPAN class="ft66">. </SPAN>A Competent Authority shall notify the Competent Authority of the other Party when the first­ mentioned Competent Authority has reason to believe that administrative errors or other minor errors may have led to incorrect or incomplete information reporting or resulted in other infringements of this Agreement. The Competent Authority of such other Party shall apply its domestic law (including applicable penalties) to obtain corrected and/or complete information or to resolve other infringements of this Agreement.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">224</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_225">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p802 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">2</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft102">Significant Non­Compliance</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p706 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">A Competent Authority shall notify the Competent Authority of the other Party when the first­mentioned Competent Authority has determined that there is significant non­compliance with the obligations under this Agreement with respect to a Reporting Financial Institution in the other jurisdiction. The Competent Authority of such other Party shall apply its domestic law (including applicable penalties) to address the significant non­compliance described in the notice.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p710 ft79"><SPAN class="ft79">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft78">If, in the case of a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution, such enforcement actions do not resolve the non­compliance within a period of 18 months after notification of significant non­compliance is first provided, the United States shall treat the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution as a Nonparticipating Financial Institution pursuant to this subparagraph 2(b).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p803 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">Reliance on Third Party Service Providers</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">Each Party may allow Reporting Financial Institutions to use third party service providers to fulfill the obligations imposed on such Reporting Financial Institutions by a Party, as contemplated in this Agreement, but these obligations shall remain the responsibility of the Reporting Financial Institutions.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p688 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft106">Prevention of Avoidance</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">. </SPAN>The Parties shall implement as necessary requirements to prevent Financial Institutions from adopting practices intended to circumvent the reporting required under this Agreement.</P>
<P class="p804 ft66">Article 6</P>
<P class="p805 ft67">Mutual Commitment to Continue to Enhance the Effectiveness of</P>
<P class="p806 ft67">Information Exchange and Transparency</P>
<P class="p679 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">Reciprocity</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">. </SPAN>The Government of the United States acknowledges the need to achieve equivalent levels of reciprocal automatic information exchange with Sweden. The Government of the United States is committed to further improve transparency and enhance the exchange relationship with Sweden by pursuing the adoption of regulations and advocating and supporting relevant legislation to achieve such equivalent levels of reciprocal automatic information exchange.</P>
<P class="p688 ft67"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft106">Treatment of Passthru Payments and Gross Proceeds</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft65">The Parties are committed to work together, along with Partner Jurisdictions, to develop a practical and effective alternative approach to achieve the policy objectives of foreign passthru payment and gross proceeds withholding that minimizes burden.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">225</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_226">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p807 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p808 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p809 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">3. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">Development of Common Reporting and Exchange Model</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p810 ft79">The Parties are committed to working with Partner Jurisdictions, the Organisation for Economic Co­operation and Development, and the European Union, on adapting the terms of this Agreement and other agreements between the United States and Partner Jurisdictions to a common model for automatic exchange of information, including the development of reporting and due diligence standards for financial institutions.</P>
<P class="p811 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">4. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">Documentation of Accounts Maintained as of June 30, 2014</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p812 ft65">With respect to Reportable Accounts maintained by a Reporting Financial Institution as of June 30, 2014:</P>
<P class="p813 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">The United States commits to establish, by January 1, 2017, for reporting with respect to 2017 and subsequent years, rules requiring Reporting U.S. Financial Institutions to obtain and report the Swedish TIN of each Account Holder of a Swedish Reportable Account as required pursuant to subparagraph 2(b)(1) of Article 2 of this Agreement; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p814 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft78">Sweden commits to establish, by January 1, 2017, for reporting with respect to 2017 and subsequent years, rules requiring Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions to obtain the U.S. TIN of each Specified U.S. Person as required pursuant to subparagraph 2(a)(1) of Article 2 of this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p815 ft67">Article 7</P>
<P class="p816 ft67">Consistency in the Application of FATCA to Partner Jurisdictions</P>
<P class="p817 ft63">1. Sweden shall be granted the benefit of any more favorable terms under Article 4 or Annex I of this Agreement relating to the application of FATCA to Swedish Financial Institutions afforded to another Partner Jurisdiction under a signed bilateral agreement pursuant to which the other Partner Jurisdiction commits to undertake the same obligations as Sweden described in Articles 2 and 3 of this Agreement, and subject to the same terms and conditions as described therein and in Articles 5 through 9 of this Agreement.</P>
<P class="p818 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The United States shall notify Sweden of any such more favorable terms, and such more favorable terms shall apply automatically under this Agreement as if such terms were specified in this Agreement and effective as of the date of the signing of the agreement incorporating the more favorable terms, unless Sweden declines in writing the application thereof.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">226</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_227">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p804 ft66">Article 8</P>
<P class="p819 ft67">Consultations and Amendments</P>
<P class="p820 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft108">In case any difficulties in the implementation of this Agreement arise, either Party may request consultations to develop appropriate measures to ensure the fulfillment of this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p821 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft108">This Agreement may be amended by written mutual agreement of the Parties. Unless otherwise agreed upon, such an amendment shall enter into force through the same procedures as set forth in paragraph 1 of Article 10 of this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p785 ft67">Article 9</P>
<P class="p822 ft67">Annexes</P>
<P class="p787 ft65">The Annexes form an integral part of this Agreement.</P>
<P class="p823 ft67">Article 10</P>
<P class="p824 ft67">Term of Agreement</P>
<P class="p825 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">This Agreement shall enter into force on the date of Sweden’s written notification to the United States that Sweden has completed its necessary internal procedures for entry into force of this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p826 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">Either Party may terminate this Agreement by giving notice of termination in writing to the other Party. Such termination shall become effective on the first day of the month following the expiration of a period of 12 months after the date of the notice of termination.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p683 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft69">The Parties shall, prior to December 31, 2016, consult in good faith to amend this Agreement as necessary to reflect progress on the commitments set forth in Article 6 of this Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p827 ft65">In witness whereof, the undersigned, being duly authorized thereto by their respective Governments, have signed this Agreement.</P>
<P class="p828 ft79">Done at Stockholm, in duplicate, in the English language, this 8th day of</P>
<P class="p677 ft65">August 2014.</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t68">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td175"><P class="p3 ft65">FOR THE GOVERNMENT OF</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td100"><P class="p3 ft65">FOR THE GOVERNMENT OF</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td175"><P class="p3 ft65">SWEDEN:</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td100"><P class="p3 ft65">THE UNITED STATES OF</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td175"><P class="p3 ft103">&nbsp;</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td100"><P class="p3 ft65">AMERICA:</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">227</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_228">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p807 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p808 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p829 ft67">ANNEX I</P>
<P class="p830 ft66">DUE DILIGENCE OBLIGATIONS FOR IDENTIFYING</P>
<P class="p831 ft66">AND REPORTING ON U.S. REPORTABLE ACCOUNTS AND</P>
<P class="p831 ft66">ON PAYMENTS TO CERTAIN NONPARTICIPATING</P>
<P class="p832 ft67">FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS</P>
<P class="p833 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">I. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft102">General</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p834 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">A.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft109">Sweden shall require that Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions apply the due diligence procedures contained in this Annex I to identify U.S. Reportable Accounts and accounts held by Nonparticipating Financial Institutions.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p835 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">B.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft110">For purposes of the Agreement,</SPAN></P>
<P class="p836 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">All dollar amounts are in U.S. dollars and shall be read to include the equivalent in other currencies.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p837 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">Except as otherwise provided herein, the balance or value of an account shall be determined as of the last day of the calendar year or other appropriate reporting period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p838 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft111">Where a balance or value threshold is to be determined as of June 30, 2014 under this Annex I, the relevant balance or value shall be determined as of that day or the last day of the reporting period ending immediately before June 30, 2014, and where a balance or value threshold is to be determined as of the last day of a calendar year under this Annex I, the relevant balance or value shall be determined as of the last day of the calendar year or other appropriate reporting period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p839 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">Subject to subparagraph E(1) of section II of this Annex I, an account shall be treated as a U.S. Reportable Account beginning as of the date it is identified as such pursuant to the due diligence procedures in this Annex I.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p840 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">Unless otherwise provided, information with respect to a U.S. Reportable Account shall be reported annually in the calendar year following the year to which the information relates.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p841 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">C.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft109">As an alternative to the procedures described in each section of this Annex I, Sweden may permit Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions to rely on the procedures</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">228</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_229">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p842 ft63">described in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations to establish whether an account is a U.S. Reportable Account or an account held by a Nonparticipating Financial Institution. Sweden may permit Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions to make such election separately for each section of this Annex I either with respect to all relevant Financial Accounts or, separately, with respect to any clearly identified group of such accounts (such as by line of business or the location of where the account is maintained).</P>
<P class="p843 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">II. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">Preexisting Individual Accounts</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft79">The following rules and procedures apply for purposes of identifying U.S.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p678 ft79">Reportable Accounts among Preexisting Accounts held by individuals</P>
<P class="p677 ft65">(“Preexisting Individual Accounts”).</P>
<P class="p844 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">A.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">Accounts Not Required to Be Reviewed, Identified, or Reported</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">Unless the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution elects otherwise, either with respect to all Preexisting Individual Accounts or, separately, with respect to any clearly identified group of such accounts, where the implementing rules in Sweden provide for such an election, the following Preexisting Individual Accounts are not required to be reviewed, identified, or reported as U.S. Reportable Accounts:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p845 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft71">Subject to subparagraph E(2) of this section, a Preexisting Individual Account with a balance or value that does not exceed $50,000 as of June 30, 2014.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p846 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">Subject to subparagraph E(2) of this section, a Preexisting Individual Account that is a Cash Value Insurance Contract or an Annuity Contract with a balance or value of $250,000 or less as of June 30, 2014.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p847 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">A Preexisting Individual Account that is a Cash Value Insurance Contract or an Annuity Contract, provided the law or regulations of Sweden or the United States effectively prevent the sale of such a Cash Value Insurance Contract or an Annuity Contract to U.S. residents (</SPAN><SPAN class="ft114">e.g.</SPAN>, if the relevant Financial Institution does not have the required registration under U.S. law, and the law of Sweden requires reporting or withholding with respect to insurance products held by residents of Sweden).</P>
<P class="p848 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">A Depository Account with a balance of $50,000 or less.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">229</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_230">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p849 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">B. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">Review Procedures for Preexisting</SPAN></P>
<P class="p850 ft101">Individual Accounts With a Balance or Value as of June 30, 2014, that Exceeds $50,000 ($250,000 for a Cash Value</P>
<P class="p851 ft115">Insurance Contract or Annuity Contract), But Does Not</P>
<P class="p851 ft67"><SPAN class="ft102">Exceed $1,000,000 (“Lower Value Accounts”)</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p852 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">1. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft102">Electronic Record Search</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft65">The Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must review electronically searchable data maintained by the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution for any of the following U.S. indicia:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p853 ft65">a) Identification of the Account Holder as a U.S. citizen or resident;</P>
<P class="p854 ft65">b) Unambiguous indication of a U.S. place of birth;</P>
<P class="p855 ft65">c) Current U.S. mailing or residence address (including a U.S. post office box);</P>
<P class="p856 ft65">d) Current U.S. telephone number;</P>
<P class="p857 ft63">e) Standing instructions to transfer funds to an account maintained in the United States;</P>
<P class="p858 ft65">f) Currently effective power of attorney or signatory authority granted to a person with a U.S. address; or</P>
<P class="p859 ft63">g) An “in­care­of” or “hold mail” address that is the <SPAN class="ft116">sole </SPAN>address the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution has on file for the Account Holder. In the case of a Preexisting</P>
<P class="p860 ft79">Individual Account that is a Lower Value</P>
<P class="p861 ft77">Account, an “in­care­of” address outside the United States or “hold mail” address shall not</P>
<P class="p860 ft65">be treated as U.S. indicia.</P>
<P class="p862 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">If none of the U.S. indicia listed in subparagraph B(1) of this section are discovered in the electronic search, then no further action is required until there is a change in circumstances that results in one or more U.S. indicia being associated with the account, or the account becomes a High Value Account described in paragraph D of this section.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p863 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">If any of the U.S. indicia listed in subparagraph B(1) of this section are discovered in the electronic search, or if there is a change in circumstances that results in one or more U.S. indicia</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">230</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_231">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p864 ft79">being associated with the account, then the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat the account as a U.S. Reportable Account unless it elects to apply subparagraph B(4) of this section and one of the exceptions in such subparagraph applies with respect to that account.</P>
<P class="p865 ft65">4. Notwithstanding a finding of U.S. indicia under subparagraph B(1) of this section, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is not required to treat an account as a U.S. Reportable Account if:</P>
<P class="p866 ft65">a) Where the Account Holder information unambiguously indicates a <SPAN class="ft117">U.S. place of birth</SPAN>, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution obtains, or has previously reviewed and maintains a record of:</P>
<P class="p867 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft118">A self­certification that the Account Holder is neither a U.S. citizen nor a U.S. resident for tax purposes (which may be on an IRS Form W­8 or other similar agreed form);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p868 ft79"><SPAN class="ft79">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft119">A non­U.S. passport or other government­issued</SPAN></P>
<P class="p869 ft64">identification evidencing the Account</P>
<P class="p870 ft65">Holder’s citizenship or nationality in</P>
<P class="p871 ft65">a country other than the United States; <SPAN class="ft117">and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p872 ft64">(3) A copy of the Account</P>
<P class="p873 ft65">Holder’s Certificate of Loss of</P>
<P class="p871 ft65">Nationality of the United States or a reasonable explanation of:</P>
<P class="p874 ft79"><SPAN class="ft68">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft120">The reason the Account Holder does not have such a certificate despite relinquishing U.S. citizenship; </SPAN><SPAN class="ft121">or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p875 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft122">The reason the Account Holder did not obtain U.S. citizenship at birth.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p866 ft116"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft123">Where the Account Holder information contains a </SPAN>current U.S. mailing or residence address, or one or more U.S. telephone</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">231</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_232">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p876 ft117">numbers that are the only telephone numbers associated with the account<SPAN class="ft65">, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution obtains, or has previously reviewed and maintains a record of:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p877 ft79">(1) A self­certification that the Account Holder is neither a U.S. citizen nor a U.S. resident for tax purposes (which may be on an IRS Form W­8 or other similar agreed form); <SPAN class="ft121">and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p878 ft79">(2) Documentary evidence, as defined in paragraph D of section</P>
<P class="p879 ft64">VI of this Annex I, establishing the</P>
<P class="p880 ft65">Account Holder’s non­U.S. status.</P>
<P class="p881 ft116"><SPAN class="ft63">c) Where the Account Holder information contains </SPAN>standing instructions to transfer funds to an account maintained in the United States<SPAN class="ft63">, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution obtains, or has previously reviewed and maintains a record of:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p882 ft79">(1) A self­certification that the Account Holder is neither a U.S. citizen nor a U.S. resident for tax purposes (which may be on an IRS Form W­8 or other similar agreed form); <SPAN class="ft121">and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p883 ft79">(2) Documentary evidence, as defined in paragraph D of section</P>
<P class="p879 ft79">VI of this Annex I, establishing the</P>
<P class="p880 ft65">Account Holder’s non­U.S. status.</P>
<P class="p884 ft79">d) Where the Account Holder information contains <SPAN class="ft121">a currently effective power of</SPAN></P>
<P class="p885 ft124">attorney or signatory authority granted to a person with a U.S. address, has an “in­care­ of” address or “hold mail” address that is the</P>
<P class="p886 ft116">sole address identified for the Account Holder, or has one or more U.S. telephone numbers (if a non­U.S. telephone number is also associated with the account)<SPAN class="ft63">, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution obtains, or has previously reviewed and maintains a record of:</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">232</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_233">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p867 ft79"><SPAN class="ft79">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft125">A self­certification that the Account Holder is neither a U.S. citizen nor a U.S. resident for tax purposes (which may be on an IRS Form W­8 or other similar agreed form); </SPAN><SPAN class="ft121">or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p887 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft126">Documentary evidence, as defined in paragraph D of section</SPAN></P>
<P class="p869 ft64">VI of this Annex I, establishing the</P>
<P class="p869 ft65">Account Holder’s non­U.S. status.</P>
<P class="p888 ft67"><SPAN class="ft63">C.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">Additional Procedures Applicable to Preexisting Individual Accounts That Are Lower Value Accounts</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p889 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">Review of Preexisting Individual Accounts that are Lower Value Accounts for U.S. indicia must be completed by June 30, 2016.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p890 ft79"><SPAN class="ft79">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft111">If there is a change of circumstances with respect to a Preexisting Individual Account that is a Lower Value Account that results in one or more U.S. indicia described in subparagraph B(1) of this section being associated with the account, then the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat the account as a U.S. Reportable Account unless subparagraph B(4) of this section applies.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p891 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">Except for Depository Accounts described in subparagraph A(4) of this section, any Preexisting Individual Account that has been identified as a U.S. Reportable Account under this section shall be treated as a U.S. Reportable Account in all subsequent years, unless the Account Holder ceases to be a Specified U.S. Person.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft100"><SPAN class="ft79">D.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft128">Enhanced Review Procedures for Preexisting Individual Accounts With a Balance or Value</SPAN></P>
<P class="p893 ft100">That Exceeds $1,000,000 as of June 30, 2014, or December</P>
<P class="p894 ft67"><SPAN class="ft102">31 of 2015 or Any Subsequent Year (“High Value Accounts”)</SPAN>.</P>
