<P class="p895 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft129">Electronic Record Search</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft79">The Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must review electronically searchable data maintained by the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution for any of the U.S. indicia described in subparagraph B(1) of this section.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">233</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_234">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p896 ft64">2. <SPAN class="ft115">Paper Record Search</SPAN><SPAN class="ft130">. </SPAN>If the Reporting</P>
<P class="p699 ft63">Swedish Financial Institution’s electronically searchable databases include fields for, and capture all of the information described in, subparagraph D(3) of this section, then no further paper record search is required. If the electronic databases do not capture all of this information, then with respect to a High Value Account, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must also review the current customer master file and, to the extent not contained in the current customer master file, the following documents associated with the account and obtained by the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution within the last five years for any of the U.S. indicia described in subparagraph B(1) of this section:</P>
<P class="p897 ft63">a) The most recent documentary evidence collected with respect to the account;</P>
<P class="p858 ft65">b) The most recent account opening contract or documentation;</P>
<P class="p898 ft63">c) The most recent documentation obtained by the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution pursuant to AML/KYC Procedures or for other regulatory purposes;</P>
<P class="p858 ft65">d) Any power of attorney or signature authority forms currently in effect; and</P>
<P class="p854 ft65">e) Any standing instructions to transfer funds currently in effect.</P>
<P class="p899 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">3. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">Exception Where Databases Contain Sufficient Information</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">A Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is not required to perform the paper record search described in subparagraph D(2) of</SPAN></P>
<P class="p900 ft64">this section if the Reporting Swedish Financial</P>
<P class="p901 ft65">Institution’s electronically searchable information includes the following:</P>
<P class="p854 ft65">a) The Account Holder’s nationality or residence status;</P>
<P class="p857 ft63">b) The Account Holder’s residence address and mailing address currently on file with the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution;</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">234</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_235">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p902 ft65"><SPAN class="ft68">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft131">The Account Holder’s telephone number(s) currently on file, if any, with the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p903 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft123">Whether there are standing instructions to transfer funds in the account to another account (including an account at another branch of the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution or another Financial Institution);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p904 ft65"><SPAN class="ft68">e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft131">Whether there is a current “in­care­of” address or “hold mail” address for the</SPAN></P>
<P class="p905 ft65">Account Holder; <SPAN class="ft117">and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p906 ft65">f) Whether there is any power of attorney or signatory authority for the account.</P>
<P class="p907 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">4. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">Relationship Manager Inquiry for Actual Knowledge</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">In addition to the electronic and paper record searches described above, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat as a U.S. Reportable Account any High Value Account assigned to a relationship manager (including any Financial Accounts aggregated with such High Value Account) if the relationship manager has actual knowledge that the Account Holder is a Specified U.S. Person.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p908 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft132">Effect of Finding U.S. Indicia</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p909 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft133">If none of the U.S. indicia listed in subparagraph B(1) of this section are discovered in the enhanced review of High Value Accounts described above, and the account is not identified as held by a Specified U.S. Person in subparagraph D(4) of this section, then no further action is required until there is a change in circumstances that results in one or more U.S. indicia being associated with the account.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p910 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft123">If any of the U.S. indicia listed in subparagraph B(1) of this section are discovered in the enhanced review of High Value Accounts described above, or if there is a subsequent change in circumstances that results in one or more U.S. indicia being associated with the account, then the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat the account as a U.S. Reportable Account unless it elects to apply subparagraph B(4) of this section and one of the exceptions in such</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">235</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_236">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p807 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p808 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p911 ft65">subparagraph applies with respect to that account.</P>
<P class="p912 ft63">c) Except for Depository Accounts described in subparagraph A(4) of this section, any Preexisting Individual Account that has been identified as a U.S. Reportable Account under this section shall be treated as a U.S. Reportable Account in all subsequent years, unless the Account Holder ceases to be a Specified U.S. Person.</P>
<P class="p913 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">E. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft102">Additional Procedures Applicable to High</SPAN></P>
<P class="p914 ft67"><SPAN class="ft102">Value Accounts</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p915 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">If a Preexisting Individual Account is a High Value Account as of June 30, 2014, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must complete the enhanced review procedures described in paragraph D of this section with respect to such account by June 30, 2015. If based on this review such account is identified as a U.S. Reportable Account on or before December 31, 2014, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must report the required information about such account with respect to 2014 in the first report on the account and on an annual basis thereafter. In the case of an account identified as a U.S. Reportable Account after December 31, 2014 and on or before June 30, 2015, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is not required to report information about such account with respect to 2014, but must report information about the account on an annual basis thereafter.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p916 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">If a Preexisting Individual Account is not a High Value Account as of June 30, 2014, but becomes a High Value Account as of the last day of 2015 or any subsequent calendar year, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must complete the enhanced review procedures described in paragraph D of this section with respect to such account within six months after the last day of the calendar year in which the account becomes a High Value Account. If based on this review such account is identified as a U.S. Reportable Account, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must report the required information about such account with respect to the year in which it is identified as a U.S. Reportable Account and subsequent years on an annual basis, unless the Account Holder ceases to be a Specified U.S. Person.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">236</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_237">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p917 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">Once a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution applies the enhanced review procedures described in paragraph D of this section to a High Value Account, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is not required to re­apply such procedures, other than the relationship manager inquiry described in subparagraph D(4) of this section, to the same High Value Account in any subsequent year.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p918 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">If there is a change of circumstances with respect to a High Value Account that results in one or more U.S. indicia described in subparagraph B(1) of this section being associated with the account, then the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat the account as a U.S. Reportable Account unless it elects to apply subparagraph B(4) of this section and one of the exceptions in such subparagraph applies with respect to that account.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p918 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">A Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must implement procedures to ensure that a relationship manager identifies any change in circumstances of an account. For example, if a relationship manager is notified that the Account Holder has a new mailing address in the United States, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is required to treat the new address as a change in circumstances and, if it elects to apply subparagraph B(4) of this section, is required to obtain the appropriate documentation from the Account Holder.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p919 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">F.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft134">Preexisting Individual Accounts That Have Been Documented for Certain Other Purposes</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft79">A</SPAN></P>
<P class="p920 ft79">Reporting Swedish Financial Institution that has previously</P>
<P class="p921 ft63">obtained documentation from an Account Holder to establish the Account Holder’s status as neither a U.S. citizen nor a U.S.</P>
<P class="p922 ft79">resident in order to meet its obligations under a qualified intermediary, withholding foreign partnership, or withholding foreign trust agreement with the IRS, or to fulfill its obligations under chapter 61 of Title 26 of the United States Code, is not required to perform the procedures described in subparagraph B(1) of this section with respect to Lower Value Accounts or subparagraphs D(1) through D(3) of this section with respect to High Value Accounts.</P>
<P class="p923 ft79">III. <SPAN class="ft100">New Individual Accounts</SPAN><SPAN class="ft66">. </SPAN>The following rules and procedures apply for purposes of identifying U.S. Reportable</P>
<P class="p924 ft65">Accounts among Financial Accounts held by individuals and opened on or after July 1, 2014 (“New Individual Accounts”).</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">237</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_238">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p925 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">A. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">Accounts Not Required to Be Reviewed, Identified, or Reported</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">Unless the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution elects otherwise, either with respect to all New Individual Accounts or, separately, with respect to any clearly identified group of such accounts, where the implementing rules in Sweden provide for such an election, the following New Individual Accounts are not required to be reviewed, identified, or reported as U.S. Reportable Accounts:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p926 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft78">A Depository Account unless the account balance exceeds $50,000 at the end of any calendar year or other appropriate reporting period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p927 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">A Cash Value Insurance Contract unless the Cash Value exceeds $50,000 at the end of any calendar year or other appropriate reporting period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p928 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">B.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft135">Other New Individual Accounts</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">With respect to New Individual Accounts not described in paragraph A of this section, upon account opening (or within 90 days after the end of the calendar year in which the account ceases to be described in paragraph A of this section), the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must obtain a self­certification, which may be part of the account opening documentation, that allows the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution to determine whether the Account Holder is resident in the United States for tax purposes (for this purpose, a U.S. citizen is considered to be resident in the United States for tax purposes, even if the Account Holder is also a tax resident of another jurisdiction) and confirm the reasonableness of such self­certification based on the information obtained by the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution in connection with the opening of the account, including any documentation collected pursuant to AML/KYC Procedures.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p929 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">If the self­certification establishes that the Account Holder is resident in the United States for tax purposes, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat the account as a U.S. Reportable Account</SPAN></P>
<P class="p930 ft64">and obtain a self­certification that includes the Account</P>
<P class="p930 ft65">Holder’s U.S. TIN (which may be an IRS Form W­9 or</P>
<P class="p931 ft65">other similar agreed form).</P>
<P class="p932 ft63">2. If there is a change of circumstances with respect to a New Individual Account that causes the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution to know, or have reason to know, that the original self­certification is incorrect or unreliable, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution cannot rely on the original self­ certification and must obtain a valid self­certification that establishes whether the Account Holder is a U.S. citizen or resident for U.S. tax purposes. If the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is unable to</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">238</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_239">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p933 ft65">obtain a valid self­certification, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat the account as a U.S. Reportable Account.</P>
<P class="p934 ft79">IV. <SPAN class="ft100">Preexisting Entity Accounts</SPAN><SPAN class="ft66">. </SPAN>The following rules and procedures apply for purposes of identifying U.S.</P>
<P class="p678 ft64">Reportable Accounts and accounts held by Nonparticipating Financial</P>
<P class="p924 ft65">Institutions among Preexisting Accounts held by Entities (“Preexisting Entity Accounts”).</P>
<P class="p935 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">A. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">Entity Accounts Not Required to Be Reviewed, Identified or Reported</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft79">Unless the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution elects otherwise, either with respect to all Preexisting Entity Accounts or, separately, with respect to any clearly identified group of such accounts, where the implementing rules in Sweden provide for such an election, a Preexisting Entity Account with an account balance or value that does not exceed $250,000 as of June 30, 2014, is not required to be reviewed, identified, or reported as a U.S. Reportable Account until the account balance or value exceeds $1,000,000.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p936 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">B.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft136">Entity Accounts Subject to Review</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">A Preexisting Entity Account that has an account balance or value that exceeds $250,000 as of June 30, 2014, and a Preexisting Entity Account that does not exceed $250,000 as of June 30, 2014 but the account balance or value of which exceeds $1,000,000 as of the last day of 2015 or any subsequent calendar year, must be reviewed in accordance with the procedures set forth in paragraph D of this section.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p892 ft66"><SPAN class="ft63">C.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft134">Entity Accounts With Respect to Which Reporting Is Required</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft79">With respect to Preexisting Entity</SPAN></P>
<P class="p937 ft63">Accounts described in paragraph B of this section, only accounts that are held by one or more Entities that are Specified U.S. Persons, or by Passive NFFEs with one or more Controlling Persons who are U.S. citizens or residents, shall be treated as U.S. Reportable Accounts. In addition, accounts held by Nonparticipating Financial Institutions shall be treated as accounts for which aggregate payments as described in subparagraph 1(b) of Article 4 of the Agreement are reported to the Swedish Competent Authority.</P>
<P class="p938 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">D. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">Review Procedures for Identifying Entity</SPAN></P>
<P class="p939 ft66"><SPAN class="ft100">Accounts With Respect to Which Reporting Is Required</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p940 ft63">For Preexisting Entity Accounts described in paragraph B of this section, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must apply the following review procedures to determine whether the account is held by one or more Specified U.S. Persons, by Passive NFFEs with one or more Controlling Persons who are</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">239</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_240">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p941 ft79">U.S. citizens or residents, or by Nonparticipating Financial</P>
<P class="p942 ft65">Institutions:</P>
<P class="p943 ft67"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft132">Determine Whether the Entity Is a Specified U.S. Person</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p944 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft133">Review information maintained for regulatory or customer relationship purposes (including information collected pursuant to AML/KYC Procedures) to determine whether the information indicates that the Account Holder is a U.S. Person. For this purpose, information indicating that the Account Holder is a U.S. Person includes a U.S. place of incorporation or organization, or a U.S. address.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p945 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft133">If the information indicates that the Account Holder is a U.S. Person, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat the account as a U.S. Reportable Account unless it obtains a self­certification from the Account Holder (which may be on an IRS Form W­8 or W­9, or a similar agreed form), or reasonably determines based on information in its possession or that is publicly available, that the Account Holder is not a Specified U.S. Person.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p946 ft67"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft132">Determine Whether a Non­U.S. Entity Is a Financial Institution</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p944 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft133">Review information maintained for regulatory or customer relationship purposes (including information collected pursuant to AML/KYC Procedures) to determine whether the information indicates that the Account Holder is a Financial Institution.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p947 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft137">If the information indicates that the Account Holder is a Financial Institution, or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p885 ft79">the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution verifies the Account Holder’s Global</P>
<P class="p948 ft65">Intermediary Identification Number on the published IRS FFI list, then the account is not a U.S. Reportable Account.</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t69">
<TR height=0>
	<TD width=36px></TD>
	<TD width=28px></TD>
	<TD width=61px></TD>
	<TD width=62px></TD>
	<TD width=29px></TD>
	<TD width=59px></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr4 td39"><P class="p23 ft65">3.</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td189"><P class="p31 ft102">Determine</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td7"><P class="p949 ft138">Whether</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td228"><P class="p33 ft102">a</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td14"><P class="p16 ft102">Financial</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr6 td67"><P class="p3 ft100">Institution</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=4 class="tr6 td229"><P class="p16 ft100">Is a Nonparticipating Financial</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr4 td67"><P class="p3 ft102">Institution</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td196"><P class="p3 ft102">Payments</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td7"><P class="p949 ft102">to Which</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td228"><P class="p3 ft102">Are</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr4 td14"><P class="p16 ft102">Subject to</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">240</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_241">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p752 ft100">Aggregate Reporting Under Subparagraph 1(b) of</P>
<P class="p950 ft67"><SPAN class="ft102">Article 4 of the Agreement</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p903 ft63">a) Subject to subparagraph D(3)(b) of this section, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution may determine that the Account Holder is a Swedish Financial Institution or other Partner Jurisdiction Financial Institution if the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution reasonably determines that the Account</P>
<P class="p951 ft79">Holder has such status on the basis of the Account Holder’s Global Intermediary</P>
<P class="p951 ft79">Identification Number on the published IRS FFI list or other information that is publicly available or in the possession of the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution, as applicable. In such case, no further review, identification, or reporting is required with respect to the account.</P>
<P class="p952 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft139">If the Account Holder is a Swedish Financial Institution or other Partner Jurisdiction Financial Institution treated by the IRS as a Nonparticipating Financial Institution, then the account is not a U.S. Reportable Account, but payments to the Account Holder must be reported as contemplated in subparagraph 1(b) of Article 4 of the Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p953 ft79"><SPAN class="ft68">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft137">If the Account Holder is not a Swedish Financial Institution or other Partner Jurisdiction Financial Institution, then the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat the Account Holder as a Nonparticipating Financial Institution payments to which are reportable under subparagraph 1(b) of Article 4 of the Agreement, unless the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p954 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft126">Obtains a self­ certification (which may be on an IRS Form W­8 or similar agreed form) from the Account Holder that it is a certified deemed­compliant FFI, or an exempt beneficial owner, as those terms are defined in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations; </SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">or</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">241</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_242">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p955 ft79">(2) In the case of a participating FFI or registered</P>
<P class="p879 ft79">deemed­compliant FFI, verifies the</P>
<P class="p880 ft65">Account Holder’s Global</P>
<P class="p956 ft65">Intermediary Identification Number on the published IRS FFI list.</P>
<P class="p899 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">4. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">Determine Whether an Account Held by an NFFE Is a U.S. Reportable Account</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">With respect to an Account Holder of a Preexisting Entity Account that is not identified as either a U.S. Person or a Financial Institution, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must identify (i) whether the Account Holder has Controlling Persons, (ii) whether the Account Holder is a Passive NFFE, and (iii) whether any of the Controlling Persons of the Account Holder is a U.S. citizen or resident. In making these determinations the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must follow the guidance in subparagraphs D(4)(a) through D(4)(d) of this section in the order most appropriate under the circumstances.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p957 ft63">a) For purposes of determining the Controlling Persons of an Account Holder, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution may rely on information collected and maintained pursuant to AML/KYC Procedures.</P>
<P class="p881 ft63">b) For purposes of determining whether the Account Holder is a Passive NFFE, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must obtain a self­certification (which may be on an IRS Form W­8 or W­9, or on a similar agreed form) from the Account Holder to establish its status, unless it has information in its possession or that is publicly available, based on which it can reasonably determine that the Account Holder is an Active NFFE.</P>
<P class="p958 ft65">c) For purposes of determining whether a Controlling Person of a Passive NFFE is a U.S. citizen or resident for tax purposes, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution may rely on:</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t70">
<TR height=0>
	<TD width=38px></TD>
	<TD width=75px></TD>
	<TD width=28px></TD>
	<TD width=35px></TD>
	<TD width=10px></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td119"><P class="p503 ft65">(1)</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td36"><P class="p310 ft65">Information</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td215"><P class="p16 ft63">collected</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr3 td119"><P class="p959 ft63">and</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td27"><P class="p3 ft65">maintained</P></TD>
	<TD colspan=2 class="tr3 td66"><P class="p3 ft65">pursuant</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr3 td230"><P class="p16 ft65">to</P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p960 ft63">AML/KYC Procedures in the case of a Preexisting Entity Account held by one or more NFFEs with an account</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">242</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_243">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p961 ft65">balance or value that does not exceed $1,000,000; <SPAN class="ft117">or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p962 ft79">(2) A self­certification (which may be on an IRS Form W­8 or W­9, or on a similar agreed form) from the Account Holder or such Controlling Person in the case of a Preexisting Entity Account held by one or more NFFEs with an account balance or value that exceeds $1,000,000.</P>
<P class="p963 ft63">d) If any Controlling Person of a Passive NFFE is a U.S. citizen or resident, the account shall be treated as a U.S. Reportable Account.</P>
<P class="p892 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">E.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft140">Timing of Review and Additional Procedures Applicable to Preexisting Entity Accounts</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p964 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">Review of Preexisting Entity Accounts with an account balance or value that exceeds $250,000 as of June 30, 2014 must be completed by June 30, 2016.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p965 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">Review of Preexisting Entity Accounts with an account balance or value that does not exceed $250,000 as of June 30, 2014, but exceeds $1,000,000 as of December 31 of 2015 or any subsequent year, must be completed within six months after the last day of the calendar year in which the account balance or value exceeds $1,000,000.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p965 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">If there is a change of circumstances with respect to a Preexisting Entity Account that causes the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution to know, or have reason to know, that the self­certification or other documentation associated with an account is incorrect or unreliable, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must redetermine the status of the account in accordance with the procedures set forth in paragraph D of this section.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p966 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">V.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft141">New Entity Accounts</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">. </SPAN>The following rules and procedures apply for purposes of identifying U.S. Reportable Accounts and accounts held by Nonparticipating Financial Institutions</P>
<P class="p967 ft64">among Financial Accounts held by Entities and opened on or after July 1,</P>
<P class="p967 ft65">2014 (“New Entity Accounts”).</P>
<P class="p968 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">A.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft128">Entity Accounts Not Required to Be Reviewed, Identified or Reported</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft79">Unless the Reporting</SPAN></P>
<P class="p969 ft65">Swedish Financial Institution elects otherwise, either with</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">243</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_244">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p970 ft79">respect to all New Entity Accounts or, separately, with respect to any clearly identified group of such accounts, where the implementing rules in Sweden provide for such election, a credit card account or a revolving credit facility treated as a New Entity Account is not required to be reviewed, identified, or reported, provided that the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution maintaining such account implements policies and procedures to prevent an account balance owed to the Account Holder that exceeds $50,000.</P>
<P class="p971 ft79">B. <SPAN class="ft100">Other New Entity Accounts</SPAN><SPAN class="ft66">. </SPAN>With respect to New Entity Accounts not described in paragraph A of this section, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must determine whether the Account Holder is: (i) a Specified U.S. Person; (ii) a Swedish Financial Institution or other Partner Jurisdiction Financial Institution; (iii) a participating FFI, a deemed­compliant FFI, or an exempt beneficial owner, as those terms are defined in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations; or (iv) an Active NFFE or Passive NFFE.</P>
<P class="p972 ft63">1. Subject to subparagraph B(2) of this section, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution may determine that the Account Holder is an Active NFFE, a Swedish Financial Institution, or other Partner Jurisdiction Financial Institution if the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution reasonably determines</P>
<P class="p901 ft79">that the Account Holder has such status on the basis of the Account Holder’s Global Intermediary</P>
<P class="p743 ft63">Identification Number or other information that is publicly available or in the possession of the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution, as applicable.</P>
<P class="p973 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">If the Account Holder is a Swedish Financial Institution or other Partner Jurisdiction Financial Institution treated by the IRS as a Nonparticipating Financial Institution, then the account is not a U.S. Reportable Account, but payments to the Account Holder must be reported as contemplated in subparagraph 1(b) of Article 4 of the Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p943 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft111">In all other cases, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must obtain a self­certification</SPAN></P>
<P class="p930 ft64">from the Account Holder to establish the Account</P>
<P class="p930 ft65">Holder’s status. Based on the self­certification, the</P>
<P class="p974 ft65">following rules apply:</P>
<P class="p975 ft65">a) If the Account Holder is <SPAN class="ft117">a Specified U.S. Person</SPAN>, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat the account as a U.S. Reportable Account.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">244</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_245">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p866 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft123">If the Account Holder is </SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">a Passive NFFE</SPAN>, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must identify the Controlling Persons as determined under AML/KYC Procedures, and must determine whether any such person is a U.S. citizen or resident on the basis of a self­certification from the Account Holder or such person. If any such person is a U.S. citizen or resident, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must treat the account as a U.S. Reportable Account.</P>
<P class="p910 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft133">If the Account Holder is: (i) a U.S. Person that is not a Specified U.S. Person; (ii) subject to subparagraph B(3)(d) of this section, a Swedish Financial Institution or other Partner Jurisdiction Financial Institution; (iii) a participating FFI, a deemed­ compliant FFI, or an exempt beneficial owner, as those terms are defined in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations; (iv) an Active NFFE; or (v) a Passive NFFE none of the Controlling Persons of which is a U.S. citizen or resident, then the account is not a U.S. Reportable Account, and no reporting is required with respect to the account.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p976 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft123">If the Account Holder is a Nonparticipating Financial Institution (including a Swedish Financial Institution or other Partner Jurisdiction Financial Institution treated by the IRS as a Nonparticipating Financial Institution), then the account is not a U.S. Reportable Account, but payments to the Account Holder must be reported as contemplated in subparagraph 1(b) of Article 4 of the Agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p977 ft65">VI. <SPAN class="ft102">Special Rules and Definitions</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">. </SPAN>The following additional rules and definitions apply in implementing the due diligence procedures described above:</P>
<P class="p978 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">A. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">Reliance on Self­Certifications and Documentary Evidence</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft79">A Reporting Swedish Financial Institution may not rely on a self­certification or documentary evidence if the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution knows or has reason to know that the self­certification or documentary evidence is incorrect or unreliable.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p979 ft65">B. <SPAN class="ft102">Definitions</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">. </SPAN>The following definitions apply for purposes of this Annex I.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">245</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_246">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p980 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft142">AML/KYC Procedures</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">. </SPAN>“AML/KYC Procedures” means the customer due diligence procedures of a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution pursuant to the anti­money laundering or similar requirements of Sweden to which such Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is subject.</P>
<P class="p981 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft142">NFFE</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">. </SPAN>An “NFFE” means any Non­U.S. Entity that is not an FFI as defined in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations or is an Entity described in subparagraph B(4)(j) of this section, and also includes any Non­U.S. Entity that is established in Sweden or another Partner Jurisdiction and that is not a Financial Institution.</P>
<P class="p982 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft142">Passive NFFE</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">. </SPAN>A “Passive NFFE” means any NFFE that is not</P>
<P class="p983 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft143">an Active NFFE, or (ii) a withholding foreign partnership or withholding foreign trust pursuant to relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p984 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft142">Active NFFE</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">. </SPAN>An “Active NFFE” means any NFFE that meets any of the following criteria:</P>
<P class="p985 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft144">Less than 50 percent of the NFFE’s gross income for the preceding calendar year or other appropriate reporting period is passive income and less than 50 percent of the assets held by the NFFE during the preceding calendar year or other appropriate reporting period are assets that produce or are held for the production of passive income;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p986 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft145">The stock of the NFFE is regularly traded on an established securities market or the NFFE is a Related Entity of an Entity the stock of which is regularly traded on an established securities market;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p987 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft144">The NFFE is organized in a U.S. Territory and all of the owners of the payee are bona fide residents of that U.S. Territory;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p985 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft145">The NFFE is a government (other than the U.S. government), a political subdivision of such government (which, for the avoidance of doubt, includes a state, province, county, or municipality), or a public body performing a function of such government or a political subdivision thereof, a government of a U.S. Territory, an international organization, a non­U.S. central bank of issue, or an Entity wholly owned by one or more of the foregoing;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p988 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft145">Substantially all of the activities of the NFFE consist of holding (in whole or in part) the outstanding stock of, or providing financing and services to, one or more</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">246</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_247">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p989 ft63">subsidiaries that engage in trades or businesses other than the business of a Financial Institution, except that an entity shall not qualify for NFFE status if the entity functions (or holds itself out) as an investment fund, such as a private equity fund, venture capital fund, leveraged buyout fund, or any investment vehicle whose purpose is to acquire or fund companies and then hold interests in those companies as capital assets for investment purposes;</P>
<P class="p990 ft79"><SPAN class="ft79">f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft146">The NFFE is not yet operating a business and has no prior operating history, but is investing capital into assets with the intent to operate a business other than that of a Financial Institution, provided that the NFFE shall not qualify for this exception after the date that is 24 months after the date of the initial organization of the NFFE;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p990 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft147">The NFFE was not a Financial Institution in the past five years, and is in the process of liquidating its assets or is reorganizing with the intent to continue or recommence operations in a business other than that of a Financial Institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p991 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft147">The NFFE primarily engages in financing and hedging transactions with, or for, Related Entities that are not Financial Institutions, and does not provide financing or hedging services to any Entity that is not a Related Entity, provided that the group of any such Related Entities is primarily engaged in a business other than that of a Financial Institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p992 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft148">The NFFE is an “excepted NFFE” as described in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations; </SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p993 ft79"><SPAN class="ft79">j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft149">The NFFE meets all of the following requirements:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p994 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">i.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">It is established and operated in its jurisdiction of residence exclusively for religious, charitable, scientific, artistic, cultural, athletic, or educational purposes; or it is established and operated in its jurisdiction of residence and it is a professional organization, business league, chamber of commerce, labor organization, agricultural or horticultural organization, civic league or an organization operated exclusively for the promotion of social welfare;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p995 ft79"><SPAN class="ft79">ii.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft151">It is exempt from income tax in its jurisdiction of residence;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p996 ft79"><SPAN class="ft79">iii.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft151">It has no shareholders or members who have a proprietary or beneficial interest in its income or assets;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p997 ft63"><SPAN class="ft65">iv.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">The applicable laws of the NFFE’s jurisdiction of residence or the NFFE’s formation documents do not permit any income or assets of the NFFE to be distributed</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">247</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_248">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p998 ft79">to, or applied for the benefit of, a private</P>
<P class="p999 ft79">person or non­charitable Entity other than pursuant to the conduct of the NFFE’s</P>
<P class="p999 ft79">charitable activities, or as payment of reasonable compensation for services rendered, or as payment representing the fair market value of property which the NFFE has purchased; <SPAN class="ft121">and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1000 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">v.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft144">The applicable laws of the NFFE’s jurisdiction of residence or the NFFE’s</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1001 ft152">formation documents require that, upon the</P>
<P class="p885 ft77">NFFE’s liquidation or dissolution, all of its assets be distributed to a governmental entity</P>
<P class="p861 ft63">or other non­profit organization, or escheat to the government of the NFFE’s jurisdiction of residence or any political subdivision thereof.</P>
<P class="p1002 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft142">Preexisting Account</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">. </SPAN>A “Preexisting Account” means a</P>
<P class="p983 ft65">Financial Account maintained by a Reporting Financial Institution as of June 30, 2014.</P>
<P class="p1003 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">C. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">Account Balance Aggregation and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1004 ft67"><SPAN class="ft102">Currency Translation Rules</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1005 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft153">Aggregation of Individual Accounts</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft79">For purposes of determining the aggregate balance or value of Financial Accounts held by an individual, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is required to aggregate all Financial Accounts maintained by the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution, or by a</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1006 ft64">Related Entity, but only to the extent that the Reporting</P>
<P class="p1007 ft65">Swedish Financial Institution’s computerized systems</P>
<P class="p901 ft79">link the Financial Accounts by reference to a data element such as client number or taxpayer identification number, and allow account balances or values to be aggregated. Each holder of a jointly held Financial Account shall be attributed the entire balance or value of the jointly held Financial Account for purposes of applying the aggregation requirements described in this paragraph 1.</P>
<P class="p1008 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">2. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">Aggregation of Entity Accounts</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">For purposes of determining the aggregate balance or value of Financial Accounts held by an Entity, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is required to take into account all Financial Accounts that are maintained by the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution, or by a</SPAN></P>
<P class="p900 ft64">Related Entity, but only to the extent that the Reporting</P>
<P class="p1009 ft65">Swedish Financial Institution’s computerized systems link the Financial Accounts by reference to a data element such as client number or taxpayer</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">248</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_249">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p933 ft65">identification number, and allow account balances or values to be aggregated.</P>
<P class="p1010 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">3. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">Special Aggregation Rule Applicable to Relationship Managers</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">For purposes of determining the aggregate balance or value of Financial Accounts held by a person to determine whether a Financial Account is a High Value Account, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is also required, in the case of any Financial Accounts that a relationship manager knows, or has reason to know, are directly or indirectly owned, controlled, or established (other than in a fiduciary capacity) by the same person, to aggregate all such accounts.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1011 ft66"><SPAN class="ft63">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft154">Currency Translation Rule</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft79">For purposes of determining the balance or value of Financial Accounts denominated in a currency other than the U.S. dollar, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must convert the U.S. dollar threshold amounts described in this Annex I into such currency using a published spot rate determined as of the last day of the calendar year preceding the year in which the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution is determining the balance or value.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1012 ft67"><SPAN class="ft63">D.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft155">Documentary Evidence</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft65">For purposes of this Annex I, acceptable documentary evidence includes any of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1011 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft156">A certificate of residence issued by an authorized government body (for example, a government or agency thereof, or a municipality) of the jurisdiction in which the payee claims to be a resident.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1013 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft156">With respect to an individual, any valid identification issued by an authorized government body</SPAN></P>
<P class="p746 ft63">(for example, a government or agency thereof, or a municipality), that includes the individual’s name and</P>
<P class="p1014 ft65">is typically used for identification purposes.</P>
<P class="p1015 ft63">3. With respect to an Entity, any official documentation issued by an authorized government body (for example, a government or agency thereof, or a municipality) that includes the name of the Entity and either the address of its principal office in the jurisdiction (or U.S. Territory) in which it claims to be a resident or the jurisdiction (or U.S. Territory) in which the Entity was incorporated or organized.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">249</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_250">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1016 ft79">4. With respect to a Financial Account maintained in a jurisdiction with anti­money laundering rules that have been approved by the IRS in connection with a QI agreement (as described in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations), any of the</P>
<P class="p1017 ft63">documents, other than a Form W­8 or W­9, referenced in the jurisdiction’s attachment to the QI agreement for</P>
<P class="p931 ft65">identifying individuals or Entities.</P>
<P class="p1018 ft65">5. Any financial statement, third­party credit report, bankruptcy filing, or U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission report.</P>
<P class="p1019 ft66"><SPAN class="ft79">E. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">Alternative Procedures for Financial</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1020 ft70"><SPAN class="ft101">Accounts Held by Individual Beneficiaries of a Cash Value Insurance Contract</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">A Reporting Swedish Financial Institution may presume that an individual beneficiary (other than the owner) of a Cash Value Insurance Contract receiving a death benefit is not a Specified U.S. Person and may treat such Financial Account as other than a U.S. Reportable Account unless the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution has actual knowledge, or reason to know, that the beneficiary is a Specified U.S. Person. A Reporting Swedish Financial Institution has reason to know that a beneficiary of a Cash Value Insurance Contract is a Specified U.S. Person if the information collected by the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution and associated with the beneficiary contains U.S. indicia as described in subparagraph B(1) of section II of this Annex I. If a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution has actual knowledge, or reason to know, that the beneficiary is a Specified U.S. Person, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must follow the procedures in subparagraph B(3) of section II of this Annex I.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1021 ft65">F. <SPAN class="ft102">Reliance on Third Parties</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">. </SPAN>Regardless of whether an election is made under paragraph C of section I of this Annex I, Sweden may permit Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions to rely on due diligence procedures performed by third parties, to the extent provided in relevant U.S. Treasury Regulations.</P>
<P class="p1022 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">G. </SPAN><SPAN class="ft102">Alternative Procedures for New Accounts</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1023 ft67"><SPAN class="ft102">Opened Prior to Entry Into Force of this Agreement</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1024 ft63">1. <SPAN class="ft101">Applicability</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">. </SPAN>If Sweden has provided a written notice to the United States prior to entry into force of this Agreement that, as of July 1, 2014, Sweden lacked the legal authority to require Swedish Financial Institutions either: (i) to require Account Holders of New Individual Accounts to</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">250</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_251">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1025 ft63">provide the self­certification specified in section III of this Annex, or (ii) to perform all the due diligence actions related to New Entity Accounts specified in section V of this Annex, then the Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions may apply the alternative procedures described in subparagraph G(2) of this section, as applicable, to such New Accounts, in lieu of the procedures otherwise required under this Annex. The alternative procedures described in subparagraph G(2) of this section shall be available only for those New Accounts opened prior to the earlier of (i) the date Sweden has the ability to compel Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions to comply with the due diligence requirements described in section III and section V of this Annex, as applicable, which date Sweden shall inform the United States of in writing by the date of entry into force of this Agreement, or (ii) the date of entry into force of this Agreement. For all other New Accounts, a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must apply the due diligence procedures described in section III or section V of this Annex, as applicable, to determine if the account is a U.S. Reportable Account or an account held by a Nonparticipating FFI.</P>
<P class="p1026 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft142">Alternative Procedures</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1027 ft63"><SPAN class="ft68">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft157">By the date that is one year after the date of entry into force of this Agreement, Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions must (i) with respect to a New Individual Account described in subparagraph G(1) of this section, request the self­ certification specified in section III of this Annex and, if provided, confirm the reasonableness of such self­certification consistent with the procedures described in section III of this Annex, and (ii) with respect to a New Entity Account described in subparagraph G(1) of this section, perform the due diligence specified in section V of this Annex and request information as necessary to document the account, including any self­ certification, required by section V of this Annex.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">251</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_252">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1028 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Sweden must report on any New Account that is identified pursuant to subparagraph G(2)(a) of this section as a U.S. Reportable Account or as an account held by a Nonparticipating FFI, by the date that is the later of (i) September 30 next following the date that the account is identified as a U.S. Reportable Account or as an account held</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1029 ft63">by a Nonparticipating FFI or (ii) 90 days after the account is identified as a U.S. Reportable Account or as an account held by a Nonparticipating FFI. The information required to be reported with respect to such a New Account is any information that would have been reportable under this Agreement if the New Account had been identified as a U.S. Reportable Account or as an account held by a Nonparticipating FFI as of the date the account was opened.</P>
<P class="p1030 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft145">By the date that is one year after the date of entry into force of this Agreement, Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions must close any New Account described in subparagraph G(1) of this section for which it was unable to collect the required self­ certification or other documentation pursuant to the procedures described in subparagraph G(2)(a) of this section. In addition, by the date that is one year after the date of entry into force of this Agreement, the Reporting Swedish Financial Institution must (i) with respect to such closed accounts that prior to such closure were New Individual Accounts (without regard to whether such accounts were High Value Accounts), perform the due diligence procedures specified in paragraph D of section II of this Annex or (ii) with respect to such closed accounts that prior to such closure were New Entity Accounts, perform the due diligence procedures specified in section IV of this Annex.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1031 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft150">Sweden must report on any closed account that is identified pursuant to subparagraph G(2)(c) of this section as a U.S. Reportable Account or as an account held by a Nonparticipating FFI, by the date that is the later of (i) September 30 next following the date that the account is identified as a U.S. Reportable Account or as an account held by a Nonparticipating FFI or (ii) 90 days after the</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1032 ft63">account is identified as a U.S. Reportable Account or as an account held by a Nonparticipating FFI. The information required to be reported for such a closed account is any information that</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">252</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_253">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1033 ft65">would have been reportable under this Agreement if the account had been identified as a U.S. Reportable Account or as an account held by a Nonparticipating FFI as of the date the account was opened.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">253</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_254">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1034 ft102">Annex II</P>
<P class="p1035 ft63">The following Entities shall be treated as exempt beneficial owners or deemed­compliant FFIs, as the case may be, and the following accounts are excluded from the definition of Financial Accounts.</P>
<P class="p1036 ft63">This Annex II may be modified by a mutual written decision entered into between the Competent Authorities of Sweden and the United States: (1) to include additional Entities and accounts that present a low risk of being used by U.S. Persons to evade U.S. tax and that have similar characteristics to the Entities and accounts described in this Annex II as of the date of signature of the Agreement; or (2) to remove Entities and accounts that, due to changes in circumstances, no longer present a low risk of being used by U.S. Persons to evade U.S. tax. Any such addition or removal shall be effective on the date of signature of the mutual decision, unless otherwise provided therein. Procedures for reaching such a mutual decision may be included in the mutual agreement or arrangement described in paragraph 6 of Article 3 of the Agreement.</P>
<P class="p1037 ft67"><SPAN class="ft158">I.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft159">Exempt Beneficial Owners other than Funds</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft65">The following Entities shall be treated as Non­Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions and as exempt beneficial owners for purposes of sections 1471 and 1472 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code, </SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">other than </SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">with respect to a payment that is derived from an obligation held in connection with a commercial financial activity of a type engaged in by a Specified Insurance Company, Custodial Institution, or Depository Institution.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1038 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">A.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">Governmental Entity</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">. </SPAN>The government of Sweden, any political subdivision of Sweden (which, for the avoidance of doubt, includes a county or municipality), or any wholly owned</P>
<P class="p1039 ft65">agency or instrumentality of Sweden or any one or more of the foregoing (each, a “Swedish Governmental Entity”). This category is comprised of the integral parts, controlled entities, and political subdivisions of Sweden.</P>
<P class="p1040 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">An integral part of Sweden means any person, organization, agency, bureau, fund, instrumentality, or other body, however designated, that constitutes a governing authority of Sweden. The net earnings of the governing authority must be credited to its own account or to other accounts of Sweden, with no portion inuring to the benefit of any private person. An integral part does not include any individual who is a sovereign, official, or administrator acting in a private or personal capacity.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1041 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">A controlled entity means an Entity that is separate in form from Sweden or that otherwise constitutes a separate juridical entity, provided that:</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">254</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_255">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1042 ft65"><SPAN class="ft68">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">The Entity is wholly owned and controlled by one or more Swedish Governmental Entities directly or through one or more controlled entities;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1043 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft145">The Entity’s net earnings are credited to its own account or to the accounts of one or more Swedish Governmental Entities, with no portion of its income inuring to the benefit of any private person; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1044 ft65"><SPAN class="ft68">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">The Entity’s assets vest in one or more Swedish</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1045 ft65">Governmental Entities upon dissolution.</P>
<P class="p1046 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">Income does not inure to the benefit of private persons if such persons are the intended beneficiaries of a governmental program, and the program activities are performed for the general public with respect to the common welfare or relate to the administration of some phase of government. Notwithstanding the foregoing, however, income is considered to inure to the benefit of private persons if the income is derived from the use of a governmental entity to conduct a commercial business, such as a commercial banking business, that provides financial services to private persons.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1047 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">B.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft161">International Organization</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">. </SPAN>Any international organization or wholly owned agency or instrumentality thereof. This category includes any intergovernmental organization (including a supranational organization) (1) that is comprised primarily of non­U.S. governments; (2) that has in effect a headquarters agreement with Sweden; and (3) the income of which does not inure to the benefit of private persons.</P>
<P class="p1048 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">C.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft161">Central Bank</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">. </SPAN>An institution that is by law or government sanction the principal authority, other than the government of Sweden itself, issuing instruments intended to circulate as currency. Such an institution may include an instrumentality that is separate from the government of Sweden, whether or not owned in whole or in part by Sweden.</P>
<P class="p1049 ft70"><SPAN class="ft162">II.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft163">Funds that Qualify as Exempt Beneficial Owners</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">The following Entities shall be treated as Non­Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions and as exempt beneficial owners for purposes of sections 1471 and 1472 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1050 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">A.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft161">Treaty­Qualified Retirement Fund</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">A fund established in Sweden, provided that the fund is entitled to benefits under an income tax treaty between Sweden and the United States on income that it derives from sources within the United States (or would be entitled to such benefits if it derived any such</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">255</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_256">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1051 ft63">income) as a resident of Sweden that satisfies any applicable limitation on benefits requirement, and is operated principally to administer or provide pension or retirement benefits.</P>
<P class="p1052 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">B.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft161">Broad Participation Retirement Fund</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">A fund established in Sweden to provide retirement, disability, or death benefits, or any combination thereof, to beneficiaries that are current or former employees (or persons designated by such employees) of one or more employers in consideration for services rendered, provided that the fund:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1053 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">Does not have a single beneficiary with a right to more than five percent of the fund’s assets;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1054 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">Is subject to government regulation and provides information reporting about its beneficiaries to the relevant tax authorities in Sweden; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1055 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">Satisfies at least one of the following requirements:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1056 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft144">The fund is generally exempt from tax in Sweden on investment income under the laws of Sweden due to its status as a retirement or pension plan;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1057 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft145">The fund receives at least 50 percent of its total contributions (other than transfers of assets from other plans described in paragraphs A through D of this section or from retirement and pension accounts described in subparagraph A(1) of section V of this Annex II) from the sponsoring employers;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1058 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft145">Distributions or withdrawals from the fund are allowed only upon the occurrence of specified events related to retirement, disability, or death (except rollover distributions to other retirement funds described in paragraphs A through D of this section or retirement and pension accounts described in subparagraph A(1) of section V of this Annex II), or penalties apply to distributions or withdrawals made before such specified events; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1059 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft147">Contributions (other than certain permitted make­up contributions) by employees to the fund are limited by reference to earned income of the employee or may not exceed $50,000 annually, applying the rules set forth in Annex I for account aggregation and currency translation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1060 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">C.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft161">Narrow Participation Retirement Fund</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">A fund established in Sweden to provide retirement, disability, or death benefits to beneficiaries that are current or former employees (or persons</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">256</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_257">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1061 ft63">designated by such employees) of one or more employers in consideration for services rendered, provided that:</P>
<P class="p1062 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">The fund has fewer than 50 participants;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1063 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">The fund is sponsored by one or more employers that are not Investment Entities or Passive NFFEs;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1064 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft164">The employee and employer contributions to the fund (other than transfers of assets from treaty­qualified retirement funds described in paragraph A of this section or retirement and pension accounts described in subparagraph A(1) of section V of this Annex II) are limited by reference to earned income and compensation of the employee, respectively;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1065 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">Participants that are not residents of Sweden are not entitled to more than 20 percent of the fund’s assets; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1066 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">The fund is subject to government regulation and provides information reporting about its beneficiaries to the relevant tax authorities in Sweden.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1067 ft67"><SPAN class="ft65">D.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft165">A Certain other Swedish Pension Fund</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft65">A Pension Fund founded in accordance with the Swedish Safeguarding of Pension Commitments, etc. Act (1967:531) [lagen 1967:531) om tryggande av pensionsutfästelse m.m.] and exempted from income tax according to Chapter 7 of the Swedish Income Tax Code (1999:1229).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1068 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">E.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft166">Pension Fund of an Exempt Beneficial Owner</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">A fund established in Sweden by an exempt beneficial owner to provide retirement, disability, or death benefits to beneficiaries or participants that are current or former employees of the exempt beneficial owner (or persons designated by such employees), or that are not current or former employees, if the benefits provided to such beneficiaries or participants are in consideration of personal services performed for the exempt beneficial owner.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1069 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">F.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft167">Investment Entity Wholly Owned by Exempt Beneficial Owners</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">An Entity that is a Swedish Financial Institution solely because it is an Investment Entity, provided that each direct holder of an Equity Interest in the Entity is an exempt beneficial owner, and each direct holder of a debt interest in such Entity is either a Depository Institution (with respect to a loan made to such Entity) or an exempt beneficial owner.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1070 ft70"><SPAN class="ft168">III.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft169">Small or Limited Scope Financial Institutions that Qualify as Deemed­Compliant FFIs</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">The following Financial Institutions are</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">257</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_258">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1071 ft65">Non­Reporting Swedish Financial Institutions that shall be treated as deemed­compliant FFIs for purposes of section 1471 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code.</P>
<P class="p1072 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">A.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">Financial Institution with a Local Client Base</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">A Financial Institution satisfying the following requirements:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1073 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The Financial Institution must be licensed and regulated as a financial institution under the laws of Sweden;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1074 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The Financial Institution must have no fixed place of business outside of Sweden. For this purpose, a fixed place of business does not include a location that is not advertised to the public and from which the Financial Institution performs solely administrative support functions;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1075 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The Financial Institution must not solicit customers or Account Holders outside Sweden. For this purpose, a Financial Institution shall not be considered to have solicited customers or Account Holders outside Sweden merely because the Financial Institution (a) operates a website, provided that the website does not specifically indicate that the Financial Institution provides Financial Accounts or services to nonresidents of Sweden, and does not otherwise target or solicit U.S. customers or Account Holders, or (b) advertises in print media or on a radio or television station that is distributed or aired primarily within Sweden but is also incidentally distributed or aired in other countries, provided that the advertisement does not specifically indicate that the Financial Institution provides Financial Accounts or services to residents outside Sweden, and does not otherwise target or solicit U.S. customers or Account Holders;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1076 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">The Financial Institution must be required under the laws of Sweden to identify resident Account Holders for purposes of either information reporting or withholding of tax with respect to Financial Accounts held by residents or for purposes of satisfying Swedish AML due diligence requirements;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1077 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">At least 98 percent of the Financial Accounts by value maintained by the Financial Institution must be held by residents (including residents that are Entities) of Sweden or a Member State of the European Union;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1078 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">Beginning on or before July 1, 2014, the Financial Institution must have policies and procedures, consistent with those set forth in Annex I, to prevent the Financial Institution from providing a Financial Account to any Nonparticipating Financial Institution and to monitor</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">258</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_259">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1079 ft79">whether the Financial Institution opens or maintains a Financial Account for any Specified U.S. Person who is not a resident of Sweden (including a U.S. Person that was a resident of Sweden when the Financial Account was opened but subsequently ceases to be a resident of Sweden) or any Passive NFFE with Controlling Persons who are U.S. residents or U.S. citizens who are not residents of Sweden;</P>
<P class="p1080 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">Such policies and procedures must provide that if any Financial Account held by a Specified U.S. Person who is not a resident of Sweden or by a Passive NFFE with Controlling Persons who are U.S. residents or U.S. citizens who are not residents of Sweden is identified, the Financial Institution must report such Financial Account as would be required if the Financial Institution were a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution (including by following the applicable registration requirements on the IRS FATCA registration website) or close such Financial Account;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1081 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">With respect to a Preexisting Account held by an individual who is not a resident of Sweden or by an Entity, the Financial Institution must review those Preexisting Accounts in accordance with the procedures set forth in Annex I applicable to Preexisting Accounts to identify any U.S. Reportable Account or Financial Account held by a Nonparticipating Financial Institution, and must report such Financial Account as would be required if the Financial Institution were a Reporting Swedish Financial Institution (including by following the applicable registration requirements on the IRS FATCA registration website) or close such Financial Account;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1082 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft164">Each Related Entity of the Financial Institution that is a Financial Institution must be incorporated or organized in Sweden and, with the exception of any Related Entity that is a retirement fund described in paragraphs A through D of section II of this Annex II, satisfy the requirements set forth in this paragraph A; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1083 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft108">The Financial Institution must not have policies or practices that discriminate against opening or maintaining Financial Accounts for individuals who are Specified U.S. Persons and residents of Sweden.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1084 ft65"><SPAN class="ft65">B.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft165">Local Bank</SPAN><SPAN class="ft67">. </SPAN>A Financial Institution satisfying the following requirements:</P>
<P class="p1085 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The Financial Institution operates solely as (and is licensed and regulated under the laws of Sweden as) (a) a bank or</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">259</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_260">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p14 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p71 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1086 ft65">(b) a credit union or similar cooperative credit organization that is operated without profit;</P>
<P class="p1087 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The Financial Institution’s business consists primarily of receiving deposits from and making loans to, with respect to a bank, unrelated retail customers and, with respect to a credit union or similar cooperative credit organization, members, provided that no member has a greater than five percent interest in such credit union or cooperative credit organization;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1088 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The Financial Institution satisfies the requirements set forth in subparagraphs A(2) and A(3) of this section, provided that, in addition to the limitations on the website described in subparagraph A(3) of this section, the website does not permit the opening of a Financial Account;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1089 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The Financial Institution does not have more than $175 million in assets on its balance sheet, and the Financial Institution and any Related Entities, taken together, do not have more than $500 million in total assets on their consolidated or combined balance sheets; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1090 ft79"><SPAN class="ft63">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft164">Any Related Entity must be incorporated or organized in Sweden, and any Related Entity that is a Financial Institution, with the exception of any Related Entity that is a retirement fund described in paragraphs A through E of section II of this Annex II or a Financial Institution with only low­value accounts described in paragraph C of this section, must satisfy the requirements set forth in this paragraph B.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1091 ft67"><SPAN class="ft63">C.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft165">Financial Institution with Only Low­Value Accounts</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft65">A Swedish Financial Institution satisfying the following requirements:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1003 ft65"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft160">The Financial Institution is not an Investment Entity;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1092 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">No Financial Account maintained by the Financial Institution or any Related Entity has a balance or value in excess of $50,000, applying the rules set forth in Annex I for account aggregation and currency translation; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1089 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The Financial Institution does not have more than $50 million in assets on its balance sheet, and the Financial Institution and any Related Entities, taken together, do not have more than $50 million in total assets on their consolidated or combined balance sheets.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1093 ft70"><SPAN class="ft63">D.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">Qualified Credit Card Issuer</SPAN>. <SPAN class="ft63">A Swedish Financial Institution satisfying the following requirements:</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p14 ft3">260</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_261">


<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p674 ft3">Prop. 2014/15:41</P>
<P class="p675 ft3">Bilaga 1</P>
<P class="p1094 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The Financial Institution is a Financial Institution solely because it is an issuer of credit cards that accepts deposits only when a customer makes a payment in excess of a balance due with respect to the card and the overpayment is not immediately returned to the customer; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1095 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">Beginning on or before July 1, 2014, the Financial Institution implements policies and procedures to either prevent a customer deposit in excess of $50,000, or to ensure that any customer deposit in excess of $50,000, in each case applying the rules set forth in Annex I for account aggregation and currency translation, is refunded to the customer within 60 days. For this purpose, a customer deposit does not refer to credit balances to the extent of disputed charges but does include credit balances resulting from merchandise returns.</SPAN></P>
